10704.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10704.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Cross County Multiplex in Yonkers, NY!

11212.description: Do you believe every child and family deserve the right to buy and eat fresh produce and healthy food at affordable prices? Are you into food justice and do you believe healthy eating is a civil right? Then, work with students, parents, educators and the community to build school-run Hip2B Healthy Market/Farmstand/Fleas in Brownsville, Brooklyn and in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Both these neighborhoods are ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! Seeking volunteers on these days! Choose any: In school, working with elementary and/or middle school students (btw 8 am and 3 pm, hours optional) - Tuesdays am - Help prep market in Flatbush (hours flexible) - - Wednesday am - Help run market - 7 -10 am (and offer any special cooking, recipes, etc.) - Thursdays - any time all day in Brownsville (help prep for market and cook with kids) - Friday am (Brownsville) - 7-10 am - Help run market and other activities - Saturdays, 9-3 pm (Brownsville) - Help run market and do activities with kids and families, including yoga, fitness like zumba, art, tutor, cook healthy recipes, etc. Do you garden? Do you want to help children grow food as well? Let us know. Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Want to join a new flea? Have a home business and want to get more exposure? Join us. WE LAUNCH BROWNSVILLE ON FEB. 3 AND FLATBUSH ON MARCH 7. Saturday Market: Set-up: 9-10 am Activities: 10 am - 2 pm Breakdown: 2-3 pm School days - we arrange with you. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Do you want to lead a healthy workshop - even with friends? A cooking demo or a dance class? In health profession? Can you do blood pressure screenings, offer nutrition or diabetes education or more? Anything more? Please join us. Parents are asking! You can also offer any kind of physical activity - dance, zumba, soccer, yoga - just for an hour in the gym. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11212.title: Food! Health! Help Brownsville, Flatbush BK kids launch healthy market days!

07302.description: Grief is an experience that everyone has; regardless of race, age, sex, religion, or financial background. For many children who face grief early in their lives, it can be a very isolating experience due to a lack of understanding and a lack of supportive people who understand their emotions and needs. Good Grief, a nonprofit in Morristown and Princeton, New Jersey, specializes in supporting the needs of grieving children through free peer support programs, education, and advocacy. Good Grief was created in 2004 and serves over 550 participants every month. However, not everyone who would like to benefit from our services has the opportunity to do so due to transportation and other needs. In order to meet the needs of urban youth, Good Grief created In Community, a program that supports underserved children and families. In Community is launching in Jersey City this spring, and will cater to children ages 6-18 who have experienced the loss of someone important in their lives, as well as providing support to their parent or guardian so that they can learn how to better understand their children’s needs. In Community will reduce isolation by creating a community of children of similar ages who have experienced loss, as well as give them the tools to develop healthy coping skills to adapt to their current and other adversities they may experience. Come and be a part of the mission today, where a team of dedicated volunteers and staff ensure that no child ever has to grieve alone. Contact Whitney Allen at whitney@good-grief.org to learn more.
07302.title: Help support grieving children and families of Jersey City!

07302.description: America Needs You fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first generation college students. We do this by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Our New Jersey program workshops take place in Jersey City or Newark Career Coaches work with college students during Saturday sessions to build their professional skills and help them realize their career potential. ANY curriculum covers all kinds of professional development topics from resume preparation and interview etiquette to giving and receiving feedback and managing up. At workshops, Career Coaches typically participate in group or one-on-one work with Fellows; for example, writing and reviewing a cover letter or building a pros/cons list for deciding between two internships. RSVP to an upcoming workshop on April 28th or May 19th in Jersey City: anynjcareercoach.eventbrite.com
07302.title: Volunteer to mentor ambitious, first-generation college students in Jersey City!

11210.description: Chefs! Join our Hip2B Healthy Movement and lead a Chef Night with students at public schools. Only 4-hour commitment on a weekday night. Particularly looking for May 9, May 20 or May 22 Challenge: Prepare with youth a nutritious, delicious meal for the same cost as a fast food combo! What you do: Before - prepare recipes (buy food and we reimburse or we supply) Day of: Come to school at 3:30 or 4 pm, work in school kitchen with the number of youth you choose from 4th grade-8th grade, and prepare a full meal - protein, vegetable, and whatever else to show parents they can cook healthy and cheaper than fast food. - Prepare with faculty and youth take-home bags with recipes... 6 pm - Make brief presentation to parents who come to eat ... about how you cooked, healthy cooking tips Everyone then eats and we clean up and are done by 8 pm YOU CAN BE A CULINARY STUDENT - OR GROUP - OR NUTRITIONIST - IDEA IS TO GIVE TOOLS IN A JOYFUL, FUN EVENING TO COOK AND EAT HEALTHY AFFORDABLY Questions: email info@seedsinthemiddle.org Locations: Flatbush, Brooklyn schools and maybe others in Crown Heights, or Brownsville...
11210.title: Chefs! Cook healthy with kids at Chef Night at NYC school

A little more detail below - FYI - if you are a chef or love to cook and want to share healthy eating, help us host Chef Nights at schools... Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? 11216.description: Calling all RUNNERS... interested in entering the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon but were not chosen in the lottery? You still can! Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC), a nonprofit that embraces and empowers children of incarcerated parents, has slots for marathon runners on our 10-person team. To learn more about the benefits of running with Team CPNYC, which includes guaranteed entry into the race, please visit: https://www.cpnyc.org/marathon Run for a reason and raise awareness for a population of children who have an incarcerated parent! ABOUT CPNYC CPNYC is a community-based organization in Brooklyn working to ensure children left behind by prisoners are empowered to break the cycle of intergenerational incarceration and imagine futures bigger and brighter than their current circumstances. All funds raised will go directly toward program support and much needed therapeutic supplies and interventions.
11216.title: Run the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon!

11217.description: Operation Manager Assistant About The Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Operations Manager Assistant to join our organization for the long term. As an Operations Manager Assistant you will work closely with the Operations Manager to meet A free Bird Organization’s organizational goals. Responsibilities Assist Operations Manager in supervising daily operations of organization. Develop productive, profitable and achievement oriented working environment for employees. Address operational issues and concerns in a timely fashion. Supervise operations team to ensure operational excellence and excellent customer services. Educate operations team on best practices, company policies and service excellence standards. Develop and maintain operational guidelines for staffs. Assist in interviewing, recruiting, training, performance evaluation, promotion Determine staffing requirements, work assignment and schedules for new projects. Coordinate with General Manager in different operational issues and promotional activities. Evaluate current operational strategies and recommend improvements. Generate operational reports for management. Competencies Leadership Conflict Management Business Negotiation Decision-Making People Management Data Entry Skills Data Processing Skills Deadline-Oriented Budget Development Critical Thinking and Problem Solving Skills Planning and Organizing Communication Skills Persuasiveness Influencing and Leading Delegation Team Work Adaptability Stress Tolerance
11217.title: Director of Finance

11217.description: Operations Manager About the company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Operations Manager to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Responsibilities Recruit, select, train, assign, schedule, coach, counsel volunteers Communicate job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising and reviewing job contributions Plan and review compensation actions; enforcing policies and procedures Contribute operations information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; prepare and complete action plans;; resolve problems; Forecast requirements; prepare an annual budget; schedule expenditures; initiating corrective actions Analyze process workflow, volunteer and space requirements and equipment layout; implement changes Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations Accomplish operations and organization mission by completing related results as needed Responsible for all department managers and supervisors, with review/approval responsibility for all operations employees Run a safe, injury/accident free workplace Establish contracts and pricing and ensuring proper maintenance and serving as primary liaison with utilities and local government agencies, such as fire, police, health and safety agencies Review and approve all operational invoices and ensure they are submitted for payment Serve as primary point of contact Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer experience, including resolving problems and complaints Work closely with GM and management team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation. Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings. 11217.description: Development Director About the Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and held accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return.

11217.description: Executive Director About the Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office in Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Executive Director to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. As an Executive director of A free Bird Organization you are the key management leader focusing on overseeing the administration, programs and strategic plan of the organization. Responsibilities Work closely with board in order to fulfill the organization mission Communicate effectively with the Board and providing, in a timely and accurate manner, all information necessary for the Board to function properly and to make informed decisions. Develop resources sufficient to ensure the financial health of the organization. Oversee and implement appropriate resources to ensure that the operations of the organization are appropriate. Engage in signing all notes, agreements, and other instruments made and entered into and on behalf of the organization. Establishing employment and administrative policies and procedures for all functions and for the day-to-day operation of the nonprofit. Report to and work closely with the Board of Directors to seek their involvement in policy decisions, fundraising and to increase the overall visibility of the Foundation throughout the State. Supervise, collaborate with organization staff. Strategic planning and implementation. Oversee organization Board and committee meetings. Oversee marketing and other communications efforts. Review and approve contracts for services. Other duties as assigned by the Board of Directors. Competencies A bachelor’s degree Transparent and high integrity leadership Five or more years senior nonprofit management experience Solid, hands-on, budget management skills, including budget preparation, analysis, decision-making and reporting Strong organizational abilities including planning, delegating, program development and task facilitation Ability to convey a vision of A Free Bird’s strategic future to staff, board, volunteers and donors Knowledge of fundraising strategies and donor relations unique to nonprofit sector Skills to collaborate with and motivate board members and other volunteers Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to interface and engage diverse volunteer and donor groups Demonstrated ability to oversee and collaborate with staff Strong public speaking ability
11217.title: Executive Director Volunteer

Reaching out via email, phone, and speaking to companies and following up with companies that you did not receive an answer from. Thinking outside of the box, we are looking for someone who has the ability to come up with incentives for companies to collaborate with A Free Bird and how they will benefit from working with us. Following up with companies that you have reached out to and see if they are interested in the program. Coming up with ideas for companies to work with the AFB and help raise funds for our Programs Dept. Travel to companies location. Have available 10-12 hours per week to devote your time to the organization Be comfortable with Google Docs creating forms and excel spreadsheets to keep track of companies Organized and professional demeanor Great communication skills. Willing to work individually as well as in a team. Be comfortable on all social media platforms and use it to reach out to many more individuals.

Being in contact with the Programs Department on the children that are available and what company will be sponsoring which child. Have availability of 10-12 hours per week. Understanding of Google Docs, and Excel Spreadsheets Organized and professional Great Communication Skills Be fluent on all social media platforms. Willing to work individually as well as in a team environment. Report back to the VP of Fundraising with progress as well as the Founder of the organization. Have some availability on the weekend. Be comfortable on social media platforms

Be comfortable with social media as you will be posting and reaching out to companies via social media outposts.
11217.title: Give Arts Coordinator Volunteer

11217.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year and in order to help as many kids as possible, we are seeking a Public Relations Coordinator/Manager volunteer who can commit 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months(150 hours). Responsibilities: Working with a small team, conceptualize and implement traditional and social media strategies and campaigns aimed at generating coverage of AFB's programs, key advocacy issues and marketing and celebrity-driven campaigns. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Produce blogs and other content for external publication. Edit commentaries produced by other AFB staff. Coach and supervise PR Intern Assistants. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Expand and nurture AFB's mainstream and social media network. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Build and manage our Twitter-sphere. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Help manage the AFB's media database, build lists and track media coverage. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities Keen insight into the news business and understanding of what makes journalists tick Proven ability to identify and market good story ideas Prefer candidate with local or hyperlocal media relationships A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11217.title: PR Social Media Coordinator

11215.description: We are looking for committed volunteers for our school programs! This spring we have two school programs volunteers can help support us with. Our Citizen Science program emphasizes the role of citizen scientists and the importance of advocating for our waterways. Citizen Science program volunteers will become familiar with water quality testing parameters, protocols and help lead groups of students through different tests. Our service-learning program introduces students to the Gowanus Canal, its polluted history and the steps to making a healthier ecosystem through stewardship. Service Learning program volunteers will engage students in stewardship activities - such as gardening, caring for street trees, and propagating plants in our native plant nursery. This is perfect for volunteers that are interested or have prior experience in education. No prior knowledge on topics or activities are needed. Programs are reserved are for Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Based on their availability and interest volunteers can help with one program or both. Volunteers must be able to commit to regularly volunteering throughout the spring season- April till June. Please email education@gowanuscanalconservancy.org if you are interested in one or both school programs.
11215.title: Ongoing Education Volunteer

10035.description: Volunteers are needed to help with this wonderful event to find a cure for brain tumors! The New York City Walk will be held at Randall's Island in NYC on Saturday, June 23, 2018. We have volunteer opportunities to assist with set up on Friday, June 22nd during the day and a large number of opportunities available on walk day ranging from registration and incentive distribution to cheerleading for our walkers, to solicitation of donated goods to help make the event go smoothly for all. If you're unavailable that day but want to help distribute marketing materials or help with sponsorships please reach out today! To see a full list of volunteer options visit: http://events.braintumor.org/events/new-york-brain-tumor-walk/volunteer-roles/ We are seeking new members to join our walk planning committee for those who want to get involved year-round to help plan and execute the walk. All funds raised through our events allow the National Brain Tumor Society to advance research and public policy to improve the availability of new and better treatments, and fuel the discovery of a cure for brain tumors. Volunteers are the bedrock our existence and this special event would not be possible without you. Thank you for your time and generosity.
10035.title: New York City Brain Tumor Walk

10035.description: Groove With Me 2018 Summer Program: We are currently accepting applications for Volunteer Dance Teachers for our Summer Grooves Program at Groove With Me, Inc. Groove With Me is a free dance school for girls (ages 4-18) in East Harlem. We engage girls during the idle out-of-school hours when 90% of youth violence occurs; and we seek to decrease teen pregnancy, truancy, crime, violence, prostitution, substance abuse and gang related activity. East Harlem has the highest unmet need for after school programming of any neighborhood in NYC. By volunteering you will provide much needed out-of-school time safety - and arts programming. At Groove With Me, we strive to provide a forum for girls to develop critical thinking skills as well as a growth mindset through Dance. Summer Programming 2018 Schedule Will Offer 2 Sessions: Classes meet 1x per week for 1 hour Session 1 will run from July 2th - July 26th (4 weeks) Session 2 will run from July 30th- August 16th (3 weeks) Teachers can select which session to teach. If you are interested in this opportunity, please give me a call at 212-987-5910 or reach me via email at beatriz@groovewithme.org Beatriz Coronel, MA Program Director Groove With Me, Inc. 186 E 123rd St NY, NY 10035 Phone: 212-987-5910 Fax: 212-987-5080 www.groovewithme.org
10035.title: Volunteer Dance Teachers Needed For A Youth Development Dance Program (Groove With Me)

10035.description: This opportunity is only available Mondays and Tuesdays. The Boys and Girls Club of Harlem is committed to providing access and opportunities for youth to reach their full potential. General Support Volunteers help achieve that goal. The Boys and Girls Club serves members from 5-18 and increasing the adult to member count allows a more meaningful experience for members. Support volunteers allow us to run programs more effectively because there are more individuals to assist in facilitation. Key Responsibilities: Club Support volunteers will assist club staff as well as members to ensure a fun and safe environment for all. This role is to ensure our members are getting the most out of their club experience. Provide programmatic and operational support to the organization. This could be academic support, walking students to different programs and assisting staff with program facilitation.
10035.title: General Support Volunteer

On Sunday, May 20th, we will be having our 9th Annual Walk at Pier 84 (44th St at Hudson River/West Side Highway). We are looking for volunteers to do everything from registration, food/beverage, greeting, cheering, and much more. We will need people from 7AM until 2PM. 10036.description: The American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division is looking for volunteers to help out at the 2018 Liver Life Walk in New York City! Event duties include: Event Set-up Duties: Assist in hanging banners, setting up tables and chairs, decorating etc. Registration Duties: Welcome participants as they check-in, pick-up their t-shirts and receive detailed information about the day. Parking Attendants Duties: Direct vehicles to empty parking spaces one at a time. There will be an area for volunteers to park separate from participant parking. Also, parking attendants will assist with placing directional signs to designate where the event is being held. Course Set-up Duties: Place route markers and educational signs throughout the walk course approximately every few blocks so walkers/runners are able to stay on the course. Responsibilities also include: 1. Deliver tables, water and cups to water stations 2. Drop-off water station volunteers and course monitors 3. During the Walk, patrol the course to pick-up any tired walkers 4. Follow the final walkers to pick up the course monitors and water stop volunteers 5. Return to the course to pick up the remaining water, cups, tables and signage Course Monitors Duties: As a Course Monitor, you will be stationed at specified intersections along the course to help participants cross any busy intersections and cheer them on to the finish. You might be asked to wear a bright orange vest to distinguish yourself. Greeters Duties: This is every participant's first impression of the event! Greet participants after they have parked and direct them to the registration area. Tent Supervisors Duties: We will be having several tents with food, drinks, games, etc. so we will need people to oversee that everything is going smoothly. Please note: We are happy to provide proof of volunteer time for those who need it for schools, community service, etc. If interested, please contact Logan Moore at lmoore@liverfoundation.org.
10036.title: 2018 Liver Life Walk New York City
10036.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

10031.description: The Boys & Girls Club of Harlem’s (BGCHarlem) mission is to provide access and opportunity for youth to reach their full potential as responsible members of the community. We believe that success is within reach of every young person that walks through our doors. Our kids benefit from trained, caring professional staff and volunteers who help them take control of their lives, envision productive futures and reach the goals. Core to this is the development of strong character and leadership skills and we seek your support to both models and encourage them as a volunteer group mentor for our Girls mentoring program. Our Girls mentoring program provides girls ages 8-17, with the skills to develop positive self-esteem, and adopt healthy lifestyle habits. Weekly participants engage in discussions on a range of topics that include media influences on females, dating relationships, and health prevention and education. Volunteers, with the support of BGCHarlem staff, will help to facilitate these discussions over a 10-week session, guiding youth through a curriculum that builds competencies in: Understanding and implementing the Boys and Girls Club of Harlem program Having in-depth and potentially uncomfortable conversations about challenges facing teens today Discussing nutrition, cooking and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Our Boys Mentoring program uses interactive activities to educate males 8-12 and 13-17 on the critical issues that young men face including decision making, wellness, careers and employment, relationships, and self-esteem This opportunity is on Monday evenings.
10031.title: Boys and Girls Group Mentoring

10030.description: Future Giants is a non profit that has operated in NYC for over 11 years. We specialize in preparing High School students for the social and academic challenges they will encounter after graduation. We have a 100 college acceptance rate and a 99 % on time High School Graduation rate. Last year we created and published a High school book that is being used in several High Schools. We are seeking Volunteers that have a direct or indirect contact with the Mayors of Baltimore and or D.C. It is our hope to recreate our success in those cities as well as open our first multi organization youth center (A.C.E) Future Giants is planning to Launch our Academic + Community = Excellence If you have any contacts with the Mayors of either Baltimore ,MD or D.C ( or the Governor) we would like your assistance in helping thousands of young people achieve their dreams.
10030.title: Reference to Mayor of D.C. and or Baltimore

Volunteers will assist clients in choosing food and help keep the pantry stocked. Volunteers must be comfortable with light to moderate lifting and movement.
10033.title: Washington Heights Food Pantry Volunteer

10032.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work on their projects. This program needs your help in Washington Heights, NYC. To sign up, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code. We'll provide the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed: Program 3288DBM-M Date: Wednesday, May 16th Time: 11:15 AM - 12:15 PM Volunteer Role: Research Coach About the workshop: Inspired by ​ David Barclay Moore’s stunning debut novel, The Stars Beneath Our Feet, about a 12-year-old in Harlem reeling from his brother’s death, eighth-graders developed a campaign against gun violence in their own community. They’ll create posters that communicate their messages, as well as a short video compilation of their individual contributions. Coaches will assist students as they research statistics for gun violence citywide and in their own communities. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10032.title: Research coach for Washington Heights, NYC public school literacy program (328dbm)

10032.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing projects. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a writing or research coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work. This workshop needs your help in Washington Heights. To sign up, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code. We'll supply the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed: Program 3287JV-T Date: Monday, May 21st Time: 10:30 AM - 12:15 PM Volunteer Role: Writing Coach About the program: In the graphic novel Ghetto Brother: Warrior to Peacemaker, Julian Voloj details the history of a 1970’s South Bronx street gang. Bilingual seventh-graders created plans for a community-based organization, along with a multi-point platform for improving their own neighborhoods. Coaches will work one-on-one to help them develop their work. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit our volunteer opportunities page at http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/. To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10032.title: Writing  coach for Washington Heights, NYC public school literacy program (328jv)

Program 41MW-P Date: Thursday, May 24th Time: 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM Volunteer Role: Field Trip Chaperone About the program: Working with author Monica Wellington , first-graders learning about gardening have planted their own flower seeds in their classroom. Her book, Zinnia’s Flower Garden, tells the story of a girl who, with the help of her cat and dog friends, demonstrates the skills needed to grow beautiful blossoms. 07430.description: Available Volunteer Training Classes Sunday, May 13th from 1:00 to 2:30PM Sunday, May 20th from 1:00 to 2:30PM Sunday, June 3rd from 1:00 to 2:30PM Sunday, June 10th from 1:00 to 2:30PM Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as side walkers and lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Under the supervision of a certified riding instructor, the side walker walks next to the horse to provide support to the rider as needed. Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as lead walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday beginning on Monday, June 25th and runs through to August 23rd. Lesson times are as follows: Morning Sessions: 8:45 to 10:45AM (except June 25th to 28th: 8:45AM to 12:15PM) Afternoon Sessions: 2:30 to 6:00PM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment.
07430.title: Volunteer Training Classes now Available

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist with our \" All HANDs In\" ( Horse Assisted Nature Driven) after-school enrichment program. All HANDs In provides an interactive, farm-based, non-riding enrichment program that offers participants, ages 14 - 21, the opportunity to enjoy a unique and unparalleled after-school experience. Sample activities include Grooming horses, lead-walking horses, preparing a whole food-based afternoon snack, stall and barn management, small animal (goats & pigs) care, and planting and care of the farm's fruits and vegetables. RESPONSIBILITES Work under the direction of the Afterschool Program Coordinator/Structured Learning Instructor Assist program participants in activities Provide one on one educational or physical assistance as needed Set up and break down of program materials/supplies Attend required trainings/meetings ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR ENRICHMENT PROGRAM ASSISTANT Mandatory training with Afterschool Program Coordinator/Structured Learning Instructor. Minimum age of 17 years with reliable transportation Must be able to commit to a full semester of programing (10 to 12 weeks - Tuesday and/or Thursdays afternoon from 4 to 6 PM) Must be able to lift 30 pounds Must be able to physically participate in a 90-minute session in both indoor and outdoor activities. SCHEDULE: Tuesdays: Mar 20 Mar 27 Apr 10 Apr 17 Apr 24 May 8 May 15 May 22 Jun 5 Jun 12 Thursdays: Mar 22 Mar 29 Apr 12 Apr 19 Apr 26 May 10 May 17 May 24 Jun 7 Jun 14 Interested volunteers can contact volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call 201-934-1001 for more information.

11213.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking a motivated youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn to join the Fiver team and support its mission of empowering the youth through character cultivation year round. Every month, Fiver Children's Foundation hosts Fiver Club, a program where Fiver participants learn character building traits that align with Fiver's three pathways to success: Education and Careers, Service and Leadership, and Healthy Life Choices. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will assist Fiver's Program Supervisor at Fiver Clubs as a support staff by facilitating certain curriculum pieces and handling behavior management. This position is responsible for creating a safe and productive environment, ensuring a high level of program quality, and working to establish a positive relationship with Fiver participants. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will review curriculum with Fiver Program Supervisor prior to the dates of Fiver Club. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to Leading and assisting with curriculum activities and games with Fiver participants that align with Fiver's three pathways to success Supporting the Fiver Program Supervisor Monitoring participants behavior Adequately observing participants activities and enforcing safety regulations and program expectations Qualifications Experience working with the youth, preferably 5th through 8th grade Flexibility Creativity Behavior management and conflict resolution skills Verbal communication skills Leadership and facilitation skills Must be willing to commit to monthly Fiver Clubs on the dates listed below Dates for Fiver Club in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center Wednesday, March 21st at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, April 25th at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, May 16th at 4pm - 6pm Thursday, June 7th at 4pm - 6pm
11213.title: Youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to build a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! We need players to coach kids ages 3 and up and help lead teams. Most children have never played soccer and some come back every season - so there's a variety of levels. This is a neighborhood with limited healthy options - to eat or get physically fit. So, you'll play a role in not only building teamwork, but empowering youth and families to get active. Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program starting now through end of summer. Weekends - Saturdays and Sundays. Thursday evenings also possible. Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Attn, Students! Yes, we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to expand a nascent league. . Kids love it, but don't know the game so we need your help. We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. Can you play in a fundraising opening soccer game? We can schedule in March! SCHEDULE - April 21 - June 23 APRIL 21 - JUNE 23 SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 12 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If we have enough players, will create boys and girls only teams for ages 10 and up.. If you're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your background so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org If you have other times you are available - even to do a workshop in a school, let us know. YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - facebook.com/seedsinthemiddle https://www.facebook.com/brooklyncrown.heightssoccer https://www.facebook.com/Soccer-for-Harmony-204551942961230/ Instagram: @seedsinthemiddle
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for Brooklyn  kids!

11357.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11357.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at College Point Multiplex in Whitestone, NY!

10038.description: NYC Take Steps is the Foundation’s largest fundraising event in the nation. Help make our event a success. We’re making some great improvements to our festival, walk and finish areas. Share this special event with us! Nearly 1 in 200 Americans live each day with Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis, life-changing digestive diseases. Living with these inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) can be painful and isolating. The Crohn's & Colitis Foundation is dedicated to curing Crohn's and colitis, and to improving the quality of life of children and adults affected by these diseases. The Take Steps community also offers a safe, supportive environment for patients and families. Patients connect with others familiar with the ups and downs of IBD, as well as the friends who support their journey. The Foundation has invested almost $300 million in research to date, enabling groundbreaking treatments and greatly enhancing lives. Make a Difference Today! There are four shifts available: volunteers can take as many opportunities to contribute as they wish. Festival: 4:30pm - 9:00pm Festival Kick-off Kid Zone Distribute T-shirts, incentives, food informational materials Usher participants Walk Guide & Spirit Crew: 6:00pm - 8:00pm Event Breakdown: 8:00pm - 10:00pm We cannot make it happen without your help! Please contact us if you have more questions.
10038.title: NYC Take Steps for Crohn’s & Colitis - Thursday May 17, 2018 at Pier 16 at the South Street Seaport
10038.org: Crohn's & Colitis Foundation - Greater NY Chapter

10038.description: Join the American Lung Association as we raise awareness and funds to fight against lung cancer and for lung health. Together, we are a FORCE to be reckoned with. The American Lung Association is recruiting volunteers to help at the upcoming Lung Force Walk on Saturday, May 19, 2018. The event will be at South Street Seaport, Pier 16 New York, NY 10038. You can volunteer anywhere from 7:30 am until approximately 2:30 pm. We are unable to have a successful event without volunteers like you. Please reach out to me if you have any questions or concerns. Did you know? Lung cancer is the #1 cancer killer in America, and most people aren’t aware. Anyone can get it - if you have lungs, you can get lung cancer, and it’s on the rise in women. More than 33 million Americans suffer from asthma, COPD (which includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis), and other lung diseases.
10038.title: NYC Lung Force Walk

10038.description: Great Strides is the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation’s signature event and its largest and most efficient nationwide fundraising campaign. This year, Great Strides will raise over $43 million in an effort to add tomorrows to the lives of all those living with cystic fibrosis. Join the Greater New York Chapter on Sunday, June 3rd (Pier 16 at the South Street Seaport, Lower Manhattan) and help us prepare for Great Strides 2018. Check-in, opening ceremonies and breakfast will begin in the morning. The walk will conclude with entertainment, our Kid’s Korner, family festival, lunch, closing ceremonies and much more. Listed below are descriptions of various volunteer roles. Your help will ensure that Great Strides 2018 is a huge success! Set-up & Signage Greeters Registration Route T-Shirt Distribution Food Distribution Clean-up Contact Shara Swift, Senior Development Manager, at 212-986-8783 or by e-mail at sswift@cff.org for more information or to sign up!
10038.title: Volunteer at the 2018 Great Strides Walk in NYC!
10038.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, Greater NY Chapter, Manhattan Branch

10038.description: We are looking for volunteers with dance experience to help run a weekly movement-based creative workshop for students with intellectual disabilities in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn, Wednesdays from 11-12. This opportunity takes place over 12 weeks, for a small group of middle and high school students. The workshop will culminate with an informal showing. We are also looking for volunteer yoga instructors in all boroughs.
10038.title: Looking for Dance Teachers and Yoga Instructors

10038.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from a beautiful office in the Financial District! We will deliver the food to the NYC Rescue Mission, located at 90 Lafayette St, New York NY 10013. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 20-40 pounds.
10038.title: Feed New York's Hungry on Fridays at 3:30PM!

10038.description: Food from cafeterias after lunch is usually thrown away. But that clean, unplated lunch food can be served to others. Join us on this hour-long food rescue event from an office cafeteria and deliver this wholesome, high-quality food to the food insecure! This event will end at Here There & EVERYwhere, located at 80 Centre St, New York, NY 10013. Heavyweight: the average amount of the total pounds of food rescued from this event is 60 lbs.
10038.title: Feed the Hungry and Fight Food Waste Fridays 2:30PM!

07044.description: Are you looking for a volunteer opportunity? Interested in volunteering your time to a worth cause while doing something you enjoy? If so, the American Liver Foundation's Greater New York Division is looking for a DJ to volunteer on Sunday, June 10th to perform at our Annual Liver Life Walk New Jersey. https://liverlifewalk.org/newyorkcity/ Date: Sunday, June 10, 2018 Location: Verona Park 411 Bloomfield Ave, Verona, NJ 07044 Time Frame: 8:00 AM - 1:00 PM Expectations: Be able to arrive at VeronaPark by 8:00 AM and stay until 1:00 PM Not shy to make announcements on the mic Must be able to provide own equipment (sound system, mic, etc.) We are looking for a variety of family friendly music to keep our walkers engaged and excited. Due to the fact that this is a fundraiser, we are looking for someone who would be willing to donate their time in exchange for sponsorship benefits, which include your logo on the event t-shirt, event website, sponsorship banner displayed in front of all walkers and spectators, etc. Liver Life Walk features a festival-type atmosphere including activities for kids, food, entertainment and information about the American Liver Foundation. If you or anyone you know is interested in learning more about this opportunity, please reach out to Logan Moore at lmoore@liverfoundation.org or at 646-737-9401. *Please note this is a volunteer opportunity
07044.title: DJ Needed in NJ!
07044.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

07044.description: The American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division is looking for volunteers to help out at the 2018 Liver Life Walk in New Jersey. Event duties include: Event Set-up Duties: Assist in hanging banners, setting up tables and chairs, decorating etc. Registration Duties: Welcome participants as they check-in, pick-up their t-shirts and receive detailed information about the day. Parking Attendants Duties: Direct vehicles to empty parking spaces one at a time. There will be an area for volunteers to park separate from participant parking. Also, parking attendants will assist with placing directional signs to designate where the event is being held. Course Set-up Duties: Place route markers and educational signs throughout the walk course approximately every few blocks so walkers/runners are able to stay on the course. Responsibilities also include: 1. Deliver tables, water and cups to water stations 2. Drop-off water station volunteers and course monitors 3. During the Walk, patrol the course to pick-up any tired walkers 4. Follow the final walkers to pick up the course monitors and water stop volunteers 5. Return to the course to pick up the remaining water, cups, tables and signage Course Monitors Duties: As a Course Monitor, you will be stationed at specified intersections along the course to help participants cross any busy intersections and cheer them on to the finish. You might be asked to wear a bright orange vest to distinguish yourself. Greeters Duties: This is every participant's first impression of the event! Greet participants after they have parked and direct them to the registration area. T ent Supervisors Duties: We will be having several tents with food, drinks, games, etc. so we will need people to oversee that everything is going smoothly. We are happy to provide proof of volunteer time for those who need it for schools, community service, etc. If interested, please contact Logan Moore at lmoore@liverfoundation.org.
07044.title: 2018 Liver Life Walk New Jersey
07044.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

07960.description: We are requesting the following: 10 volunteers for setup/breakdown and execution of event Food donations from vendors: subs, sandwiches and/or pizza cotton candy machine and supplies kid's craft corner clown/character photographers
07960.title: Donations for goods/services needed for Great Strides-MORRISTOWN
07960.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07960.description: We are beginning to recruit interested volunteers for our upcoming New Jersey Confidential Sexual Violence Victim Advocate (CSVA) training, which is slated to begin in July 2018 (5 Weeks, Tuesdays and Thursday from 6PM-10PM). During the 40 hour training volunteers are educated about topics regarding sexual assault statistics, prevention, and response. Crisis intervention and advocacy support skills are taught and guest speakers, including law enforcement, military experts, and mental health professionals present information. When the volunteer completes the training and receives the CSVA status, they are required to manage the crisis hotline for three 12 hour shifts per month. (The hotline is forwarded to the volunteer's telephone for their shifts.) In addition to hotline, the advocate's second responsibility per shift is to accompany survivors of sexual assault to the hospital as needed. Although this is a challenging volunteer position, the experience is very rewarding (and looks great on a resume too)! Join our team and support survivors!
07960.title: Sexual Assault Response Team Advocate Training

11214.description: Looking for a volunteer to teach SAT class to a small group of immigrant youths in Bensonhurst area. Monday to Friday 11am-1pm for 6 weeks in the summer.
11214.title: SAT teacher

07009.description: The New Jersey Heart Ball, attended by more than 450 individuals from New Jersey's corporate, medical, pharmaceutical, and social communities, is the annual black-tie gala benefitting the American Heart Association's lifesaving mission of building healthier lives, free of cardiovascular disease and stroke. For more than 20 years, the New Jersey Heart Ball has promoted the American Heart Association's mission on a local level and thanks to our donor support, we have seen inspiring advances in the fight against heart and stroke related illnesses. Your support is crucial to the success of the event! Please keep in mind that once you commit to being a volunteer, we're counting on you to attend, participate, and have some fun! We encourage all volunteers to be flexible with their responsibilities throughout the evening, as we may need to make last minute changes as the evening progresses. Some of the volunteer jobs: - Registration assistants - Greeters - Check out assistants - Set-up/breakdown - Live auction assistants - Seating assistants - Open Your Heart spotters - Silent auction monitors - Silent auction greeters - Mobile bidding concierge - Directional assistants - Silent auction runners
07009.title: NJ Affair of the Heart Ball

10306.description: Great Strides is the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation’s signature event and its largest and most efficient nationwide fundraising campaign. This year, Great Strides will raise over $43 million in an effort to add tomorrows to the lives of all those living with cystic fibrosis. Join the Greater New York Chapter on Sunday, June 10th (Midland Beach, Staten Island) and help us prepare for Great Strides 2018. Check-in, opening ceremonies and breakfast will begin in the morning. The walk will conclude with entertainment, our Kid’s Korner, family festival, lunch, closing ceremonies and much more. Listed below are descriptions of various volunteer roles. Your help will ensure that Great Strides 2018 is a huge success! Set-up & Signage Greeters Registration Route T-Shirt Distribution Food Distribution Clean-up Contact Shara Swift, Senior Development Manager, at 212-986-8783 or by e-mail at sswift@cff.org for more information or to sign up!

10306.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, Greater NY Chapter, Manhattan Branch

10305.description: Sunday, May 20th | Staten Island | 2:00pm-4:00pm Have fun and make an impact during The Jewish Board's 2018 Month of Hope! Throughout the month of May, some of The Jewish Board's programs will host a wide variety of exciting volunteer projects. Join the young adolescents in designing and painting a mural to beautify the walls of their residence.
10305.title: Month of Hope: Mural Making in Staten Island
10305.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10302.description: About The Volunteer Role: MRNY is seeking a volunteer with teaching experience to teach a citizenship class to ESL students looking to pass their naturalization exams to become US citizens. MRNY offers a collaborative environment for volunteers who take part of this opportunity. The volunteer will: Look closely at the materials and lesson templates provided by our staff to adapt the lesson plans/materials to fit a 2 hr class. Send the MRNY staff materials for printing or bring printed material (we have a printer in the office available for your use). Teach the civics class on Mondays to multi-level English learners seeking to take a naturalization interview. Communicate during the evening with the volunteers recruited to do mock exams to ensure that students are given adequate practice Maintain effective communication with the team regarding anything that seems unclear, questions s/he may have, the status of the class and the students, and other things related to the class. We also ask that volunteers respond in a timely manner to emails from staff about the class. Training and support that MRNY can provide: Orientation about MRNY materials for citizenship class General Orientation (about MRNY, the volunteer role, the students, community, collaborative approaches, etc...) A couple of class observation in our Queens location (the volunteer observes the citizenship classes taught by MRNY staff in our Queens location) Phone meetings (scheduled with the volunteer) A room for teaching Student enrollment and pre-testing Printer, laptop, projector and speakers are available for use Our Volunteer Community: It is important to us that participants have a strong desire to support and work with the immigrant community. Great teamwork, effective communication skills, a positive attitude, and an interest in adult education as it relates to student speakers of other languages, or the desire to learn about these is required from all our volunteers. ​
10302.title: Strengthen Immigrant Communities- TEACH A CITIZENSHIP CLASS

10301.description: We are Community Agency for Senior Citizens, Inc. We have been in Staten Island for over 40 years. We only serve Older Adults. The program is called the Friendly Visiting Program. The program began in January/2017. We look to \"Match\" you with an Older Adult. The program asks that you spend one hour in the Client's home. While visiting the Client, you can have a cup of coffee/tea, play a table top game, cards, read a book together, watch a movie. The visit is what you both decide upon. This is a building block relationship. So far, many of our \"Match's\" have become good friends and look forward to these weekly visits.
10301.title: Do You Want to Brighten Someone's Day? Volunteer's Are the Sunshine that Homebound Adult's Need
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

07704.description: The Girls on the Run 5K is an inspiring event with over 1000 participants many of them girls running their first 5K. Volunteers are needed for registration, t-shirts, course marshals and water stations. Our volunteers are an integral part of the race and appreciated by all of the participants!
07704.title: Girls on the Run 5K Volunteers

07701.description: The Salvation Army in Red Bank needs volunteers to assist with our After School Program providing homework instruction to students aged between 6-12 years old. Volunteers may also be required to lead or help with educational activities. Complete CHRI - Criminal History Records Information Finger Printing Requirement (The Salvation Army will provide the information required to complete the fingerprinting request) NO COST TO VOLUNTEER www.bioapplicant.com/nj All Volunteers must provide a copy of a Health Physical from a Doctor stating that they are in good health. This can be provided by their primary doctor, an urgent care, or even the campus medical facility. All Volunteers must get a TB-Tuberculosis Test done before beginning work with the children. This can be provided by their primary doctor, an urgent care, or even the campus medical facility. Complete State required childcare Background Check CARI -Child Abuse Record Information (The Salvation Army will provide the information required to complete the background check) NO COST TO VOLUNTEER. : 3:00pm3:00pm3:00pm3:00pm To: 5:30pm5:30pm5:00pm5:00pm
07701.title: After school homework/ reading help- Red Bank
07701.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07701.description: Our Afterschool Feeding Program continues a long tradition of providing for children’s most basic needs ultimately striving to address deeper or long-term issues. We provide an afterschool meal on Monday and Wednesday, to 21 children many of whom count on The Salvation Army for a meal to end their day. We provide these meals in two shifts, 3:15 and around 3:30. Volunteers should be able to lift at least 50lbs and be able to work with a diverse group of people. Volunteers should enjoy working with children and previous experience volunteering with children would be a plus. The volunteer should also work well with others and be willing to work as part of a team. The volunteer should also be dependable, responsible and committed.
07701.title: Afterschool Meal Prep
07701.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

10029.description: Union Settlement is hosting an animal museum exhibit, \"Edventure!\", on Saturday, May 19th as part of our 26th Annual Ethnic Festival and we need volunteers to help! Volunteers will assist staff with set-up of the animal museum and guide our visitors from exhibit to exhibit, where our staff will show visitors the animals and share information about them. After the volunteer shift, volunteers can stay and enjoy the exhibit and the rest of the festival! Where: Union Settlement, 237 East 104th Street, New York, NY 10029 When: Saturday, May 19th Available Shifts: 11am-1pm, 1pm-3pm, 3pm-5pm Individuals interested in signing up should email volunteers @unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Animal Museum Volunteer\" and include the shift(s) they would like to sign up for.
10029.title: Volunteer at our animal museum exhibit, "Edventure!"

10029.description: Help Union Settlement celebrate its 26th Annual Ethnic Festival on Saturday, May 19th! The festival is a day-long block party celebration of East Harlem and offers music, dance, arts and crafts, ethnic cuisine and educational activities for all ages. It attracts thousands of residents and visitors from the greater New York City area through its rich and varied offerings. We're looking for individual volunteers and volunteer groups who are interested in helping our staff host another successful festival! Come volunteer with us and then stay and enjoy the celebration! Volunteers are needed to help in 2 areas: - We need volunteers to help us set up for the festival from 8am to 11am. There are 1, 2, and 3-hour shifts available, where volunteers will assist staff with decorating festival areas and booths. If you are interested in helping with festival set-up, please contact volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Festival Set-Up Volunteer\" to learn more about available shifts. - We're also looking for volunteers to help staff at various booths and activities throughout the day. Activities include bounce houses, an animal museum exhibit, pony rides, craft pavilions, mural painting, and more. Each shift is 2 hours and available shifts are 11am-1pm, 1pm-3pm, and 3pm-5pm. If you are interested in helping with the booths and activities, please contact volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Ethnic Fest Volunteer\" and include your preferred shift time(s). Event: 26th Annual Ethnic Festival Where:East 104th Street between 2nd and 3rd Avenues When:11am-5pm (set-up is from 8am to 11am)
10029.title: Volunteer at our 26th Annual Ethnic Festival!

10029.description: We need caring, committed child care volunteers to assist in the our Building Bridges group, an art therapy group for immigrant moms who have experienced loss and trauma. This groupo helps support healing through art creation and art activities. This position requires empathy, caring for children in a group setting. The moms are in the group, so you are part of the Building Bridges group. Assist with children in the group (moms bring them along, help set up/clean up; helping in the facilitating of the the art activities of the mom. Spanish speaking helpful, but not necessary. An interest or background in art therapy helpful, but not necessary. Class meets on Thursday mornings, from 9 am to 12 pm. Please email the Volunteer Director with your resume to tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Assist with Child Care needs in our Art Therapy Group with Moms on Thursdays

10029.description: EHTP seeks passionate volunteers to work with elementary and middle school students during our summer program! Our summer program runs Monday through Friday, and volunteers play a huge role in making the summer successful. Volunteers can choose between the morning or afternoon shifts or do a full day. In the mornings, volunteers support our teachers and scholars during academic instruction. Including: Providing logistical and operational support to their assigned classroom Supporting students during academic lessons in one-on-one and small group settings In the afternoons, volunteers support during field trips, outdoor activities, and enrichment clubs. Including: Providing logistical and operational support during club time (i.e. music, dance, art etc.) Engaging with students in club and outdoor activities such as soccer and field time Attending field trips with students Volunteers must commit to a minimum of 3 shifts a week or 2 full days for the full 4 weeks of program. When : July 2 - July 30, 2018; Monday - Friday Times : 7:45am - 12:15pm (Morning) and/or 12:00pm - 4:00pm (Afternoon) All interested volunteers must apply online here: http://bttr.im/ubhw2 If you have any questions, please contact our Associate, Volunteers & Interns, Raúl Lazo, at volunteerinfo@ehtp.org Requirements Volunteers must be at least 14 years old Summer Program is a highly active environment and volunteers must be able to climb multiple flights of stairs, carry heavy boxes, stand for a minimum of 4 hours a day, feel comfortable supervising children in outdoor and indoor settings, and participate in physical activities such as running and sports Acceptance is contingent on clearance of a Criminal Background and Medical Check (forms provided during application process)
10029.title: Volunteer in Our Summer Program & Support Our Scholars!

10029.description: DREAM, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer T-ball coaches to work with youth ages 5-7 in practices and games. Coaches teach T-ball and provide youth with opportunities to play, learn and grow; inspiring them to recognize their potential and realize their dreams. Each coach serves as a member of a small coaching staff. There are powerful rewards gained from the DREAM coaching experience. DREAM volunteer coaches can have a direct and noticeable impact on the positive development of the youth they coach. The ideal candidate is passionate about youth development, has experience working with youth, and can commit to attending six Saturday practices and games in July/August, as well as a one-day pre-season coaches training in June. Roles and Responsibilities: Guide a team of 16-18 youth through practices and games; Ensure youth safety on the field; Provide a fun and positive, team-based environment; Attend all practices and games on six Saturdays in July and August. Qualifications: Passionate about youth development; Understand the power of teamwork; Have the ability to create a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching T-ball; Organized, energetic and flexible; Skilled communicators; Experience in baseball/softball a plus; Able to commit to six Saturdays, in July and August; At least 18 years of age. Hours: Coaches conduct practices and games for an hour and a half on six Saturday mornings or afternoons from 7/7/18 to 8/11/18. Coaches must be able to commit to attend all six Saturday coaching sessions during the summer, as well as the coach training day in June. DREAM provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer T-Ball Coaches!

10026.description: Each Wednesday, we prep & serve a simple vegetarian meal offering in Central Harlem for anyone who needs a meal. One can help cook and/or serve and/or clean up. Time commitment is flexible: 2 & 1/2 hours to prep/cook, 1 hour to set up/serve, 1 hour clean up. One can help out with any part of the meal. Any level of skill is accepted.
10026.title: Volunteer To Cook & Serve Every Wednesday

10026.description: Come enliven the intellect and spirit of the youngest of curious learners who are ages 3, 4, or 5! In our program, you will work with a Teacher to support the teacher in her classroom instruction. You will have the opportunity to practice your craft of becoming an early childhood instructor. Lessons that will be facilitated will concentrate in the areas of Science, Engineering, Robotics, and Art. Literacy and Math circle times will also be incorporated. Though your coursework may not concentrate in the area, as many early childhood programs do not, that's ok. Your study or experience in early childhood education is welcomed. If you are student of Education, you are welcome to develop lesson plans that center around a specific topic in your coursework, as well as video that lesson and obtain feedback from the Teacher of record. If you are an early childhood teacher, and you are in transition or are retired, you are welcome to contribute your mastery in our space. Thank you in advance!
10026.title: Calling Early Childhood Student Teachers! We're Looking For STEM PreK Instructors

11226.description: National Step League is step competition program, comprised of over 400 step teams ranging from ages 9 to 21. Our competition series runs from January to June, progressing from State Level to the Regional Level, and ultimately to our Annual National Championship. We will be having our NYC Step Competition on May 26, 2018 comprised of elementary, middle and high school teams, all performing for the chance to win 1st place in their division and claim the title for the National Championship in Atlanta, Georgia in June..
11226.title: NYC Step Show Championship

We’re making some great improvements to our festival, walk and finish areas. Share this special event with us! Set-up: 11:00am - 5:00pm Unloading supplies Arrange barricades Decorations Signage Assist vendors Festival: 4:30pm - 9:00pm Festival Kick-off Kid Zone Distribute T-shirts, incentives, food informational materials Usher participants Walk Guide & Spirit Crew: 6:00pm - 8:00pm Event Breakdown: 8:00pm - 10:00pm We cannot make it happen without your help! Please contact us if you have more questions.
