11225.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work on their projects. This program needs your help in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, NYC. To sign up, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code. We'll supply the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed. Program 2412SV-W Date: Wednesday, May 16th Time: 9:30 AM - 1:00 PM Volunteer Role: Field Trip Chaperone About the program: The Museum by Susan Verde inspired second-graders to explore their intuitive responses to art and write about the experience. After accompanying the class to Socrates Sculpture Park in Long Island City, field trip chaperones will guide small groups of students as they view the exhibits and choose a piece that resonates with each one. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit our volunteer opportunities page at http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
11225.title: Field Trip Chaperone for for Crown Heights, Brooklyn, NYC public school literacy program (241sv)

11225.description: This program is for teens and college students looking for a seasonal volunteer opportunity. Based in the Prospect Park Zoo's Education Department, Discovery Guides are seasonal volunteers (14 - 22) who receive training in customer service and basic interpretation. Discovery Guides focus on a select group of visitor experiences and, in turn, gain experience with teaching, leadership, public speaking, and learn about animals and the wild places they inhabit! Discovery Guides will: Interact with children, families, and general visitors at select exhibits and educational activities around the zoo Help out with zoo birthday parties on weekends Interact with children in the Discovery Center and at our Nature Playscape Participate in the Wildlife Conservation Society's Conservation Action campaigns We are currently recruiting youth for Summer 2018. Training will be June 10, 17, 24, 28 & 29. Volunteers must commit to two full days per week for the summer season. Applications will be available on our website in March, and are due by May 1, 2018. To request an application sooner, email the Volunteer Coordinator at ppzvolunteer@wcs.org.
11225.title: Summer Discovery Guide

11225.description: We are a 501 (C) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the arts. A Free Bird will be hosting it's 3rd Annual Gala on November 16th and we are in need of volunteer photographers and videographers. You will receive credit for photos/videos used as well as a special mention in our brochure. We are seeking people who have done photographer/videography before at big events and know how to create incredible stills. We ask a few photographers/videographers show up when we do for setup at 11:00am. The event ends at 9:00pm so the latest we would need you is until 9:30/10:00pm. For clean up and sometimes the events goes over a bit, other photos might need to be taken as individuals are leaving.
11225.title: Photographer/Videographer Volunteer

10025.description: The New Jewiish Home, Manhattan Division has a wide variety of opportunities for high school and college students to volunteer with over the summer vacation. Opportunities vary and we will try our best to meet your interest Opportunities include but not limited to: Recreation Assistant (Bingo, Games, Exercise, Arts & Crafts, Nail Spa) Pharamacy (selective, limited spots) Library Assistant (upkeep of shelving, assisting book selections, assisting computer users) Clerical/Office Assistant Please apply online at the following link: https://www.volgistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?ap=1114206372 Please mention Volunteer Match & Summer Volunteering in your application If you have any questions - Please contact Jessica at JSinovoi@jewishhome.org
10025.title: Summer Volunteer at The New Jewish Home (HS & College students)
10025.org: The New Jewish Home, Manhattan Division

10025.description: Volunteers are needed for the Annual PFF Walk taking place in Central Park on Saturday, June 23rd. The PFF Walk is the Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation’s national fundraising event with walks taking place in New York, Chicago, and Washington, D.C. Join us as we unite the community, raise funds, build awareness, and sustain vital programs that help people with PF and their families live better lives. Volunteer opportunities include: General Setup: Help set up tables, chairs, signs and other miscellaneous items Tear Down: Help take down and pack up tables, chairs, signs, and other miscellaneous items after the Walk concludes Registration: Welcome & register walkers T-Shirt Distribution: Help pass out T-shirts to walkers Course Marshalls: Help direct walkers along the walk route Food Distribution: Prepare and hand out food and beverages to walkers
10025.title: PFF Walk

10025.description: Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Spring 2018 session. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! How we do it: The Parris Foundation curriculum combines innovative and interactive software and teaching techniques with hand-ons interdisciplinary experiments and activities to keep our students engaged with their passion for science and math! About The Parris Foundation: The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation's S.T.E.M.ulating Minds: Weekend Enrichment Programs provide extended learning opportunities to supplement and enhance in-school learning.
10025.title: Spring 2018 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: Top Honors is a non-profit educational organization that provides free math tutoring to NYC 5th, 6th, 7th, and 8th-graders. Tutoring takes place on Saturdays and Wednesday evenings at a school on the Upper West Side. New volunteer orientation and training sessions take place on a rolling basis. To receive an invitation, please submit an application here. Frequently asked questions about the TH volunteer experience can be found on our website. All tutoring sessions take place on the Upper West Side in Manhattan on the following days and times: Session 1: Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. Session 2: Saturdays from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Session 3: Wednesdays from 6:30 p.m. to 8 p.m. Volunteers may be professionals, advanced high school, college, or graduate students (community service credit is available). Applicants should be available on Saturdays for two hours starting at 10 a.m. or 1:00 p.m. or on Wednesdays from 6:30 - 8 pm, like math, and enjoy working with students in the middle school age group (10-14 years). No prior experience is necessary. A note on volunteer commitment: Tutors attend 2-3 Saturdays from October and May, which includes holidays and school breaks. Attending 22 out of 27 scheduled sessions will meet this requirement. To apply, submit an online application at www.tophonors.org/volunteer. Upon receipt, Top Honors will contact the candidate directly.
10025.title: Do you love MATH? Volunteer MATH Tutors needed!

10023.description: What is a Make-A-Thon? ​The Manhattan Make-a-thons are a series of hands-on events that bring together the design process and problem solving strategies students need to build in order to navigate school, jobs, and life. The May 19th Manhattan Make-a-thon at MLK Campus will bring together all the schools in the MFSC Maker Ed Cohort to not just showcase what they accomplished over the school year, but to also share the Making experience with attendees. What will you be doing? Our volunteers will be working 1:1 with our student makers! You will be helping prep materials behind the scenes and supporting students with their creations! ​Additional Info Hands-on Maker projects from MFSC Maker Ed Cohort Schools led by teacher and student Makers! Short Film Festival Maker Educator Forum HS Paper Roller Coaster Challenge Harlem Samba and more! To learn more go to tinyurl.com/mfscmakered ​ Shifts* Morning Shift: 8:30am-12:00pm Afternoon Shift: 12:30pm-4:00pm *you are more than welcome to do both shifts!
10023.title: Make-A-Thon!

10023.description: Event Preparations A team of ten Volunteers are needed to help set-up and event, May 19th 2018. 11:00 am to 4:00 pm Positions Sign-in-Desk- 2 Volunteers Room Set-up all Volunteers Bar Table ( wine and water) 2 volunteers Food table- three Volunteers, (finger food) Room Monitors- 3 Volunteers If you are interested please contact my by April 10th, 2018 The position will be removed when we reach the amount needed. I can be reached at descort@projectfind.org Please visit our web-site www.projectfind.org
10023.title: Volunteer  Cecbration

10023.description: Help us assemble and \"delineate\" the AIDS Walk New York route before the Walk starts and break down the route once walkers have completed it. Delineator Volunteers must be comfortable with physical activity and lifting. Be prepared to get a little dirty! AIDS Walk Shift: Sunday, May 20 from 7 a.m. - 4 p.m. Meet at Central Park West and 72nd Street.
10023.title: Delineators - AIDS Walk NY 2018

10023.description: Our business internship program provides a unique opportunity for volunteers to economically empower small business owners in east Africa. After learning about each business owner’s situation and challenges, volunteers present ideas, opportunities, and solutions. After the internship program, participants will be able to put international consulting, leadership, and other valuable experiences on their resumes. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. Because the program is strengthened by diverse experience and expertise, the program is not limited to business minds only. All are welcome to apply. www.marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer as a Business Intern in Africa!

10023.description: Hola! Somos una organizaci?n sin fines de lucro que ayuda a la comunidad inmigrante latina y no latina de Nueva York en el aprendizaje del idioma ingl?s, en la preparaci?n para el examen de ciudadan?a estadounidense y en el desarrollo de otras actividades de empoderamiento para la comunidad inmigrante. Tambi?n ofrecemos clases de espa?ol para no hispanohablantes, con lo cual contribuimos adem?s a la difusi?n de la cultura y valores hispanos en los Estados Unidos. Estamos a la b?squeda de profesores de Espa?ol (voluntarios) para nuestras clases de primavera 2018 (mayo 3 - junio 22 2018). Las clases son una vez por semana (jueves) de 6:00 pm a 9:00 pm. Esta es una posici?n de voluntariado (sin pago). Si te gusta ayudar a la gente y a la comunidad por favor comun?cate con nosotros respondiendo este aviso. Habr? una sesi?n de entrenamiento previo al inicio de clases fecha tentativa. Muchas gracias!
10023.title: Volunteer Spanish Teachers

10023.description: Centro NYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can be available weekday evenings to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Greeting students and managing class check-in, as well as new student registrations -Facilitating nightly \"intercambio\" break sessions between classes, by preparing/breaking down snack preparations, managing snack sales, and encouraging students to practice language skills -Participating in major marketing initiatives for the organization -Admin office tasks such as assisting teaching staff, checking voicemails and returning calls Commitment: Volunteers will be expected to meet either Tuesdays OR Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:00pm beginning Tuesday, May 1 st and ending on Thursday, June 21 st. We also hope volunteers can be present during our end of term celebration on Friday, June 22 nd. If time constraints exist, there may be flexibility around start/end times for shifts. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/ Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge.
10023.title: Operations/Admin Volunteer - Tuesday or Thursday Evenings

10023.description: Centro NYC, a non-profit organization serving the immigrant community in New York City, seeks volunteer ESL teachers for its 2018 spring term, beginning May 1 and continuing through June 22. However, we hope that you will continue to volunteer with us in the fall. Classroom English teaching experience is preferred. However we do recruit new teachers with strong English communication skills and a good feel for grammar, even if you don't know all the rules! New teachers are partnered with and mentored by experienced teachers. Time commitment: One Tuesday or Thursday evening per week teaching plus the time required for lesson preparation (usually every other week.) Classes meet Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6:30-9:00 p.m. near Lincoln Center in Manhattan, and teachers are asked to arrive 6-6:15 to set up. In addition, there will be one staff meeting in April, and possibly one mid-semester. We have openings for teachers of beginning, intermediate, and advanced students. Please respond by email to Susan at susan@CentroNYC.org. Include your resume and tell us the evening(s) that you're available for teaching. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Adult English / ESL Teachers ? VOLUNTEERS NEEDED!

10023.description: Our pre-health program is specially catered to students preparing for medical school and other health professions. During the course of the trip, volunteers explore health, hygiene, and nutrition in the developing world. We have the ability to cater the experience in Africa to medical school, dental school, nursing school, and other pre-health career needs. Volunteers gain valuable first-hand experience in clinics, orphanages, and communities. We will be happy to write a letter of recommendation on your behalf at the end of your service. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. www.marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer as a Medical Intern in Africa!

10023.description: Volunteers participate in the development of impoverished communities in East Africa by partnering with village leadership and the community. In most cases, leadership in remote areas seek help in accomplishing their goals for education, health, and business but often lack sufficient resources and expertise to achieve those goals. Marafiki Africa volunteers help them to achieve their goals and experience the rich culture of East African tribes. A few examples of past projects include a water pipeline, school restoration, medical clinic restoration, and hygiene kit distribution. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer in Africa!

10023.description: We are seeking enthusiastic, creative, industrious, responsible, punctual, and best of all, creative people who can generate fun every moment of the STEM summer day camp experience. Depending upon your experience, you will work as a STEM Teacher, STEM Junior Teacher, Head Counselor, or Group Leader in the classroom, in offsite locations, or in the gymnasium/outdoor playground. Must have tons of energy, a willingness to make a fool of yourself for the sake of making someone smile, the ability to give \"warm fuzzies\" on a daily basis, and a desire to have FUN! If you have experience in any of the following, this camp is for you: visual art, music, dramatic art, mad science, coding, maker faire, financial literacy, entrepreneurship, community service, activism, literacy, education, chess, juggling, sports, yoga, fire throwing, marching band, drill team, gardening, cooking, learning, sharing the love and joys of learning and making friends with children.
10023.title: Teach kids how to code, engineer, and love Science!  Looking For STEM Summer Camp Teachers - NYC

10020.description: May 16th, 2018|Wednesday|5:30pm The Jewish Board is now accepting applications for our Summer Volunteer Program. If you are interested in volunteering, please apply to a volunteer role/position by May 8th, 2018. If you are interested in volunteering, please apply to a volunteer role/position by May 8th, 2018. 10020.title: Volunteer Orientation!

10020.description: May 10-May 30 Do you want to assist but cannot commit time to physically attend one of our volunteer events? Well now you have the opportunity to do great service from home. Join our volunteer team as digital resume reviewer. Sign up for this role and receive resumes of our clients who actively engaged in the competitive workforce. Once your done, you simply email the edited resume(s) back to us. Please RSVP to learn more!
10020.title: Resume Reviewer
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10020.description: June 5th, 2018|Tuesday|6:00pm-7:30pm Join us in knitting/crocheting squares to be made into blankets for the children and adolescents living in The Jewish Board residences. Enjoy soothing teas as we knit together. Beginners welcomed! We will have helpful and patient experienced knitters to help. Needles and yarn will be provided.
10020.title: Tea and Knit Night!
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10020.description: As an Office Support Assistant, you have the opportunity to support the administrative functions of our agency in various capacities and settings. Duties include, but are not limited to : filing, copying, creating and maintaining data, program specific projects, and managing telephone lines. Office Support Assistants are needed in all five boroughs! This role is ideal for someone who has: · Clerical skills · Typing skills · Experience with Microsoft Word · Customer Service experience (preferable) Time commitment and hours are flexible. Please complete a volunteer profile and inquire with the volunteer team for more information: volunteer@jbfcs.org
10020.title: Office Support Assistant
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 124-year old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We seek to increase students' language skills, confidence in speaking and comprehension of English. Volunteers are needed to teach one class per week on Fridays, 9:30am-12:00pm from April 13 - June 15. Training and supervision are provided but volunteers will need to prepare weekly lesson plans for their class and write brief summaries of student progress.
10021.title: English as a Second Language Instructor

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premiere human services providers, is a 124-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated sevices on Manhattan's East Side. Our CARE program is an arts-based day program for older adults with dementia. The program provides a caring and engaging environment that allows participants to be involved in group and indvidulaized activities, while providing a respite for family caregivers. As a volunteer Program Assistant you will assist staff in leading therapeutic activities such as visual and performing arts projects, live music performances and health and welllness programs for our participants.
10021.title: Program Assistant - CARE Program for Older Adults with Dementia

10021.description: We are seeking a Japanese speaker to meet with a senior that speaks Japanese as part of Lenox Hill Neighborhood House's Friendly Visiting Program. Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, in partnership with the NYC Department for the Aging, connects volunteers with homebound older New Yorkers to have in home visits on a regular basis. For volunteers, friendly visiting offers the opportunity to cultivate a lasting friendship, to learn from a senior’s life experiences, and to benefit from the personal satisfaction derived from community service. Friendly visiting leads to the creation of meaningful relationships between older adults and volunteers, promoting intergenerational understanding. For the senior, friendly visiting provides a sense of connection to the outside world, something to look forward to, and a sense of contributing to society through sharing their wisdom, knowledge, talents and stories with you. Tasks: Have weekly social, in-home visits with an older adult you are matched with Provide monthly reports/updates to the Friendly Visiting program coordinator Requirements: Commit to being a Friendly Visitor for a minimum of six months Be comfortable establishing a relationship with an older adult Honest, mature, motivated, patient Ability to maintain confidentiality Willing and able to contact the program coordinator should problems arise Participate in an in-person interview Undergo and pass a background check and provide references Email monthly report of hours to coordinator
10021.title: Japanese Speaking Friendly Visitor Needed

07643.description: Education Coach Internship Description: Every Monday and Wednesday Under the direction of the MFSC Staff, Homework Coaches will work with children from K-12 to provide academic support. Homework Coaches will be coaching a group of 5 children similar in age. The coaches’ primary responsibility is to ensure that the children have completed their work accurately as well as assisting them when needed. This is a part-time volunteer position. Homework coaches should have previous experience working with children; however relevant coursework will be considered. This position is a good fit for an aspiring teacher or youth worker with a background in working with kids. Internship Requirements: Interns must be flexible, may require some nights Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment Currently enrolled in college or currently has Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with relevant coursework and or previous work with children Comfortable with children and all/most subject areas from Elementary to High school Strong communication, organizational, and professional demeanor MFSC will work with College/University if credits/hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Education Coach

07643.description: Tutor and coach K-12 students withe academic support at the Meadowlands Success Center.
07643.title: Homework Helpers in Little Ferry

11743.description: Help young parents learn to give positive behavioral feedback to their pre-school children. Volunteers interact with the childen in planned activities while the group leader counsels with parents. Thursdays from 1:00 - 3:00 in Huntington.
11743.title: Mommy and Me
11743.org: Family Service League of Suffolk County

11743.description: Who doesn't love the warmth and unconditional love from a beautiful four legged furry pet? If you love dogs, and I mean, really love dogs then you can be part of a rewarding experience. Our exclusive Pet Therapy program is currently looking for chaperones. We have committed pet therapy handlers who bring their trained and certified dogs to the hospital to visit our patients. As a chaperone you will be . . . escorting the handler and dog to the patient floors on various units. engaging and interact with our patients & families and wonderful caregivers. providing hand sanitizer to all who pet the dog. greeting patients and introducing the pet handler and pet therapy dog. able to commit to one day a week for a maximum of 2 hours, usually not more than an hour. The presence of a dog in a hospital setting allows the patients to feel more at home, as they do play a small part of the healing process. The immediate gratification you will see on the patients' and staffs' faces when they are interacting with the dog is truly amazing. There are known benefits for pet therapy visits . . . improves mood and overall well-being decreases stress and anxiety lowers blood pressure lets patients reminisce about their own animals If you are interested in volunteering in our program, please contact me for an interview. Alice Messina Patient Liaison Pet Therapy Coordinator 631-351-2399 amessina2@northwell.edu
11743.title: Pet Therapy Chaperone

08837.description: Akhil Autism Foundation looking for volunteers who are passionate about teaching have some experience with special need children They will be teaming with parents and teach various subjects from grade level 1 to High school or higher or topics as per the students like. Its a no paid job at present can become paid in future depending how it goes. open minded reading to learn new learning style, passionate about working and analysing the individuals learning style. contact manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: Tutors needed special need children in NJ

08837.description: We are looking for Master of Science in Education (MS.Ed.) interns. Highly motivated professionals Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods Willing to work with autism and other disabilities Training will be provided From Internship to Paid after school for 3 hrs per day please email manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: We are looking for Special educators interns.

08837.description: Hiring interns/college students with specialities in special education to work with our 16 year old son diagnosed with Autism. (Bachelor's or Masters degree education) Highly motivated and energetic professionals. Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods (e.g. Ipad based communication) Training will be provided. 1-3 hrs per day. Contact Manisha Lad: 732-887-4263
08837.title: Help us find Tutor-Helper-Buddy for our son (16 yr old)

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: homework tutoring

07652.description: The following goods/services are needed: Set-up includes tents, tables/chairs, signs, balloons, registration, mission, and children's activity areas prior to event. Individuals are needed at the start of event to cover registration (registering walkers, handing out shirts and other items), children's activities and food station. Volunteers to help clean-up after event Food donations from vendors: subs, sandwiches and/or pizza cotton candy machine and supplies kid's craft corner clown/character photographers
07652.title: Day-of volunteers for Great Strides-PARAMUS
07652.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07652.description: We need your support! Go the Distance for Autism Bike Ride is in need of volunteers for this years Ride. We have opportunities for all skill sets. Please go to https://www.gtd4autism.org to sign up. Or email me, Michelle; Crew & Volunteer Coordinator at mharper@eventage.net
07652.title: GoTheDistance for Autism

07871.description: Help is needed starting at 8:30AM setting up and picking up to 8:30 PM cleaning up and closing silent auction and 50/50 raffle. In between, help is needed with registration, selling \"Bundles of Fun\", 50/50 tickets, etc. as well as with silent auction and supervising prize holes outdoors on the golf course. Volunteers can help the entire 12 hours or in shifts of 4 or more hours. Volunteers must be 18 years or older. This event raises money to support brain research and student summer fellowships in neuroscience that will lead to cures and treatments for brain diseases such as: Alzheimer's, PTSD, Parkinson's, autism, depression, addiction, epilepsy, MS, traumatic brain injury, brain cancer, etc.
07871.title: IES Brain Research Foundation Golf Outing & Dinner

07018.description: A diverse board of trustees brings added value to the community we serve. We are seeking members with backgrounds in law, education and medicine. Passion for children’s education and well-being a must.
07018.title: Board of Trustees membrr

07974.description: This is an excellent opportunity for groups or businesses to volunteer! Since 2002 we have hosted a free STEM (Science Technology Engineering & Math) competition for middle school students in north NJ. This program challenges the students to work as a team to create a model solar powered car. In the process they learn communication skills, alternative energy technology, the engineering design process and have best of all they have fun! We award students for Speed, Engineering, Craftsmanship, Best Use of Recycled Materials and Progress Journal. We need volunteers to assist with the Speed portion of the competition by being Start Line and Finish Line Judges. We need Vehicle Judges to score cars in Engineering, Craftsmanship and Best Use of Recycled Materials. We have remote volunteer opportunities as well for scoring the students digital Progress Journal. We need volunteers to help at our Fix-It Table to repair broken cars. We need volunteers to distribute a digital survey for teachers and students. Most of all, we need volunteers that will be a positive and supportive voice as hundreds of middle school students present their creations. We need our volunteers to be able to arrive at 7:30am. Students arrive at 8:30am and racing begins at 9am. The award ceremony concludes at noon the latest and then we take down the event. This is an outdoor event but if we have inclement weather, we move indoors. You will be provided with an official \"Volunteer\" shirt to wear all day as well as a thank you present for your time. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, please reach out to me at ktomasicchio@transoptions.org or call our office at 973-267-7600.
07974.title: Volunteer at a Model Car Competition!

10314.description: The Retired and Senior Volunteer program is searching for volunteers, 55 or older, in Staten Island to join our Veterans Support Unit. Needed are volunteers who can assist veterans enrolled in college with their studies by proofreading essays and papers, and/or tutoring in various subjects especially advanced math and science (biology). Most tutoring sessions will be held on campus but virtual volunteering is possible in some cases. Days and hours are flexible. Retirees in the fields of education, nursing and engineering are also needed to serve as career mentors. Please contact Tami DiCostanzo at 347-525-7789 for more information or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org.
10314.title: Retired Teachers/Nurses/Engineers Needed to Help Veterans with College Studies

10314.description: If you 55 years of age or older and looking for a way to stay active and healthy, are newly retired, or just have some free time on your hands - then volunteering is for you. The Retired and Senior Volunteer Program of the Community Service Society is a national program that matches people who want to help, with a volunteer assignment that best suits their skills and interests. The time commitment can be as little as 2 hours a day to several days a week -- depending on how much time you want to share. As a volunteer you can feed the hungry at soup kitchens and food pantries or by delivering meals to homebound elderly. You can visit the sick as a Hospice volunteer or nursing home friendly visitor. RSVP volunteers also help by tutoring children who are having difficulty learning to read, and by preparing adults and recent immigrants for the high school equivalency exam or to find employment. Some volunteers help by providing administrative support at local non-profit organizations, while others assist local museums and cultural institutions as docents. There is usually something for everyone! There are dozens of opportunities right here in Staten Island. To learn more about this program and to see if volunteering is right for you, call 718-494-3222 or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org. A little of your time can make a big difference in someone else’s life.
10314.title: Variety of oppotunities for Older Adults in Staten Island

07011.description: This walk a thon is a free carnival for the families with autism. There will be food, music and rides. This walk raises funds that goes back to trainings and recreation for the autism community.We need volunteers to help with food, rides, and entertainment for the kids and their families. looking for volunteer that is also bilingual. Not a necessity.
07011.title: Walk for a difference

08873.description: New people to join a dedicated core group who provide Basic Life Support ambulance service.
08873.title: Emergency Medical Technician

08873.description: The 5K Walk 4 Life Breast Cancer Awareness Run/Walk highlights the commitment Sisters Network of Central NJ has to advancing breast cancer education, awareness, advocacy and community outreach. It is a celebration of survivorship and also serves as a remembrance of loved ones who succumbed to this disease.
08873.title: SNCNJ 5K Run / Walk 4 Life
08873.org: Sisters Network of Central New Jersey

10562.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Yonkers Riverfront Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html
10562.title: Summer Reading Buddies

10019.description: Together One New York (TONY) is starting a new program for English classes. The opportunity will generally run on Monday to Thursday evenings from 6 to 9 PM. Teachers are expected to volunteer in hour and a half increments from 6-7:30 or 7:30-9:00. As a teacher you will be responsible for compiling a lesson plan, but you are welcome to use our extensive teaching material to structure classes. Prior teaching experience is a plus, but certainly not required as we have many first time teachers who have come in and successfully led our classes. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community. For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10019.title: Volunteer English Teachers

10019.title: Administrative and General Office Assistant Volunteer

10019.description: It is difficult and sometimes impossible for seniors to travel by themselves to necessary appointments such as doctors and dentist appointments, and on necessary errands such as food shopping. The Senior Escort program makes these crucial trips possible. Encore’s Senior Escort Program is a volunteer program designed to give much needed assistance and support to aging members of our community. Otherwise, due to physical frailty and disability, vision or hearing impairment, and cognitive problems, our senior neighbors are forced to cancel their trips - which leads to rapid decline in health and quality of life. Things to know: As a volunteer, you will meet the senior at their front door, accompany them to their appointment or errand, and then accompany them back to their home. Trips typically take 1-3 hours, depending on the circumstance. You will travel via public transportation (each individual is responsible for their own metro card) or via cab (the senior participant is responsible for cab fees) The clients we serve live in Manhattan south of 110th Duties include: Helping the older person dress in outerwear such as coat, sweater or hat for the trip Helping the older person lock and unlock his/her residence Helping the older person with physical strains such as assistance on stairs and carrying/pushing the grocery cart Requirements: Commitment of at least 6 months Weekly commitments, preferred Successful criminal background check & reference check Flexible hours Monday-Friday and/or available at least one day a week Attend program orientation & training Must be at least 18 years old Sensitive and empathic with the senior population *Important* Schedule: The program is not a fixed schedule. Requests come in every week, at different times and days Monday-Friday. Volunteers must have flexibility during the work week, i.e. a part-time job, or flexible work hours. It is required that you have at least one entire day free from Monday-Friday, we will place the volunteer on an on-call basis depending on the requests that come in that week. Your role as a volunteer in this program is incredibly valuable and rewarding. Senior program participants are so grateful for your time and help. It is a simple but vital service.
10019.title: URGENT NEED! Encore’s Shop & Escort Program. Accompany Seniors To Medical Appointments. Thank You!

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

10018.description: Global Green conducted Sustainable Neighborhood Assessments (SNAs) in 29 communities across the United States from 2012 to 2016 through a Building Blocks for Sustainable Communities grant with the US Environmental Protection Agency’s Offce of Sustainable Communities. The goal of this technical assistance effort was to enable communities to utilize established sustainability tools to further promote comprehensive analysis and informed decision making related to neighborhood planning and public investment in order to reduce environmental impacts, mitigate climate change, increase economic resilience, and promote social equity. Our review of this project revealed that 24 projects were built, 53 plans for future improvement projects were adopted, 10 project proposals were developed, and over $280 million in funding from the US Department of Housing and Urban Development and other federal agencies to fund related projects in these communities We’re looking for a few illustrative graphics to show the process, work and impact in this work to explain how the program works and what has been its impact. https://static1.squarespace. com/static/ 5548ed90e4b0b0a763d0e704/t/ 5a6277c008522917fb2ffe07/ 1516402627160/SNA_2.0_ FinalReport+%281%29.pdf The summary report (above) provides a great description but it is long and not that accessible for readers who want to get a quick idea of the work and process. We're looking for a graphic designer to support us with between 1-3 infographics, illustrations and/or graphics that showcase *how* the process works and/or what has been the *impact.* As we move forward with more work that is similar to these past projects we expect that these communications will be valuable. The work will be posted on globalgreen.org, included in presentations and shared with cities and community organizations who have interest in the program. A focus of the upcoming programs will include coast regions impacted by extreme weather events or those that are seeking to be more resilient to future storms.
10018.title: Graphic Designer Needed for Sustainable Neighborhoods Program
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking an efficient and detail-oriented Accounting Department Intern to join their team! The Accounting Department Intern will work with Fiver's Operations and Accounting Department in a fast-paced environment and report to the Accounting Department. This position is responsible for keeping recorded financial information current. The Accounting Department Intern will have the opportunity to develop personally and professionally throughout their internship with Fiver Children's Foundation by assisting Fiver in making a positive impact on the lives of youth throughout New York City and central New York. Responsibilities include: Entering credit card and donation transactions into QuickBooks Reclassifying account codes on existing finance entries Management of credit card purchase receipts and vendor bills Documenting payment information on bills Any additional tasks related to this position as assigned Requirements for this position: Detail oriented Self-starter who can execute assignments independently A strong work ethic and sets high standards for his/her/their own work Strong organizational skills Must be comfortable with numbers Experience with data entry in Excel and QuickBooks preferred, but not required Must be able to commit at least 20 hours a week for 6 months Fiver's Accounting Department Intern will: Attend a training on software that will be used throughout the internship Be a member of a vibrant and diverse team of staff members and volunteers Develop professionally throughout their internship Assist Fiver Children's Foundation make informed financial decisions with the information collected, organized, and updated in Fiver's database Play a crucial role in a nonprofit organization that makes a 10-year commitment to the youth from underserved communities throughout New York City and central New York and empowers them to make ethical and healthy life choices, become engaged citizens and succeed in school, careers, and life Time commitment Must be able to commit a minimum of 15 - 20 hours a week If you are interested in this internship opportunity, please email your resume and a description of why you are interested in this position to casie@fiver.org.
10018.title: Accounting Department Intern

10018.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking two (2) efficient and detail-oriented Database Administrative Volunteers to join their team! Fiver;s Database Administrative Volunteers ill work with Fiver's Operations and Accounting Department i a fast-paced work environment. Responsibilities for this position include but or not limited to, recording important information about the participants who attended and will attend Camp Fiver, Fiver's Summer Residential Program. This information is crucial when evaluating the success of Camp Fiver, evaluating and seeking funding, scheduling of Camp Programs, and maintaining pertinent contact information about Fiver Families. Fiver's Database Administrative Volunteers will assist Fiver in making a positive impact on the lives of youth throughout New York City and Central New York by successfully fulfilling the responsibilities of the volunteer position. Responsibilities include: Review Camp Fiver 2018 Applications and Health Forms Enter and update information collected from Fiver's 2018 Camp Applications Check for accuracy regarding addresses, Program Stages and assigned Session for each participant Conduct outreach for outstanding documents Any additional tasks related to this position as assigned Requirements for this position: Detail oriented Self-starter who can execute assignments independently A strong work ethic and sets high standards for his/her/their own work Strong organizational skills Analytical skills Experience with data entry and Excel preferred Language Skills Required: Spanish speaking preferred, but not required Fiver's Administrative Volunteers will: Attend a training on the software that will be used throughout the volunteer position Play a crucial role in a nonprofit that makes a 10-year commitment to youth throughout New York City and central New York and empowers them to make ethical and healthy life choices, become engaged citizens, and succeed in school, careers, and life. Be a member of a vibrant and divers team of staff members and volunteers Develop professionally through this volunteer position Assist Fiver Children's Foundation with the organization of information regarding Fiver participants who attended and will be attending Camp Fiver this summer Time Commitment: Must be able to commit a minimum of 10 - 15 hours on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday Dates: May 2018 - August 2018 If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please email your resume to casie@fiver.org.
10018.title: Database Administrative Volunteer

10018.description: Every Seed Planted Helps a Flower Grow! As a Seed Coach you will form a one-to-one advising relationship with a young woman of color to transform her passion and dreams into a powerful story for her resume and college essay. Seeds of Fortune, Inc. executive and Seed Coach team is a dynamic community of young professional women on a mission to provide creative and academic guidance, support, and opportunities for the next generation. Seed Coaches for the 2017-18 program will be provided 3 H.S scholars to work with throughout the summer and fall. TO QUALIFY AS A SEED COACH, YOU ARE: Equipped with at least two years of professional experience and great writing skills Ready to commit to Attendance at Boot Camp Digital once a week bi-weekly one-to-one writing and college sessions (Sept-Nov) Monthly in-person SEED workshops (Sept-Dec), and other special events Prepared to maintain clear and frequent communication with Seeds of Fortune, Inc.’s Program staff and your Scholar Eager to share in our mission to empower the next generation of women of color ​ AS A SEED COACH, YOU CAN EXPECT:​ To become an essential part of a young girl finding her voice Training and ongoing guidance as you build her college application Frequent communication with compassionate and knowledgeable staff and experienced volunteers An opportunity to grow with a dynamic community, and team retreat
10018.title: Seed Coach

10018.description: As climate change increases, one of the expected impacts is that temperatures in some areas will increase, and more generally extreme temperatures will become more likely. This is expected to put increased stress on the demand for heating and cooling - an aspect of energy production that has not gained the same traction as the large gains solar and wind have built in recent years. Global Green is a national environmental non-profit with offices in New Orleans, NYC, Los Angeles and NYC. We're seeking help from a researcher to evaluate market conditions, and best available technologies for renewable heating and cooling as a component of climate resiliency. Global Green is seeking 2-3 volunteers with a focus on: - policy and market conditions research - technology assessment and evaluation Each volunteer opportunity can be structured around the skills and interests of each volunteer while fitting within the larger overall research program. Additionally, we welcome research to be published as authored or co-authored content on Global Green's blog.
10018.title: Renewable thermal and Resiliency Research
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

Entryway/Greeter Volunteers - Greeting guests, directing attendees toward check-in, and providing basic event information Check-In Volunteers - Greet guests, hand out wristbands to attendees after check-in, ensure all attendees sign waivers, and general guest management Curated Care - Support Curated Care staff as needed Super Soccer Stars - Support Super Soccer Stars staff as needed Bubble Dad - Support Bubble Dad staff as needed Big City Fishing - Support Environment and Education staff as needed Face Painting - Line control, manage waiting guests and ensure organization Stroller Parking - Encourage guests to leave strollers, highlight that volunteers will not be responsible for watching strollers (leave at own discretion) Info Table - Distribute collateral, answer guest questions, and direct partners Perimeter Marshalls - Ensure/direct all guests to use main entrance at check-in, answer basic event questions, and block key entryways

10013.description: For many new immigrants, learning English is a first step to full participation in American society. Help them take that first step by becoming a volunteer teacher in English or Citizenship classes. English classes help students improve their communication skills. Citizenship classes help students prepare for the U.S. citizenship test. Volunteers work in teams to plan lessons and teach the class. This fun and rewarding experience gives you a chance to make a difference in the lives of others. Individuals with an interest in education careers are encouraged to apply. Requirements Must have good communication skills and a strong desire to help and work with new immigrants Prior teaching experience is preferred. Bilingual skills are a plus. We prefer volunteers who can commit to teaching at least two semesters Prospective volunteers must complete application and be interviewed. Volunteer Schedule: 9:30 am-11:30am (Tues or Thurs) 10:30 am-12:30 pm (Tues or Thurs) 1pm to 4pm (Saturday) 6:30pm to 8:30 pm (Mon, Tues or Wed) Spring 2018 - February 27, 2018 to June 7, 2018 Summer 2018 - July 9, 2018 to August 18, 2018 Prospective volunteers must complete application and will be interviewed. Please contact us at cpanyc@cpanyc.org for an application OR apply on-line here: http://bit.ly/volunteerteacherapplication For more information: http://bit.ly/VolunteerToTeachEnglishorCitizenshipClass
10013.title: Teach English or Citizenship Class in Chinatown

10013.description: VOLUNTEER NEEDED FOR OUR MANHATTAN OFFICE INSIDE OF FEDCAP. DUTIES: --Greet the client --Explain that we take pictures and they have to sign a waiver [(we can cut their heads off on the picture, should they not want to be seen) Not mandatory for receiving services] --Measure assist them in tying a tie (if they do not know how) finding a suit, shirt, slacks, shoes, etc. that fits. (They can try on the clothing in the restroom.) --Arrange for the hemming of pants or the sewing on of buttons with the tailor and set a date for the client to pick up the tailored items. If no alterations are needed, then fold up the items and place in a bag for the client. --Keep records of activities and calls in the log. --Be able to work alone, with minimal supervision or with others We are doing one day a week, for now (date to be discussed), but the time will be 10 AM to 3 PM. This is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to go into law enforcement and who wants to see \"the other side\" after a person comes home, someone that wants to be in the fashion industry, or social services/non-profit sector. You will be networking with everyday people, politicians, individuals from different programs (formerly incarcerated individuals, etc.), City organizations/programs, and pastors. There is a possibility that you will be helping with administrative work and our events as well. You must be neat and presentable. We also will need you to assist in pop-up shops and the occasional donation pick up. Check out what we do to get a better feel for 100 Suits http://www.100suits.org/100-suits-speaks Please be reliable! SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY!!!
10013.title: Fashion and Justice Volunteer (Queens)

10012.description: SAY: The Stuttering Association for the Young is in search for passionate, friendly, and energetic volunteers eager to help us with our annual signature event, The Chef’s Gala, hosted this year by Tony Award-winning Broadway star Kelli O’Hara, and featuring the chef’s tastings of world renowned Chef Marc Vetri and 15 other top chefs. SAY is a national non-profit organization that empowers, educates, and supports young people who stutter and the world that surrounds them. Since 2001, SAY has offered comprehensive, innovative programs that address the physical, social, and emotional impacts of stuttering. Each year, SAY hosts its annual fundraising event, The Chef’s Gala. This signature event includes a performance at NYU’s Skirball Center for the Performing Arts and an incredible Chef’s Tasting at The Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers. Volunteer opportunities include: talent wrangling, ticket stuffing, escorting, providing directions, checking in guests, setting décor, and assisting with a live auction. Volunteers are needed the following dates and times: SUNDAY, MAY 20, 2018: 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM MONDAY, MAY 21, 2018: 7:00 AM - 11:00 PM Please note that there are shifts available throughout this day. If interested, please send an email with your name, phone number, and availability to T.C. Lind at tc@nouveauproductions.co (.co not .com). For more information on SAY, please visit www.say.org For more information on the 16 th Annual Chef’s Gala, please visit www.say.org/gala
10012.title: SAY's 16th Annual Chef's Gala
10012.org: STUTTERING ASSOCIATION FOR THE YOUNG INC

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Charity Walk Committee Members Needed - NYC

10011.description: GRANT WRITER The Grant Writer is primarily responsible for developing and writing grant proposals to foundations and other grant-making organizations, and will persuasively communicate CSP's mission and programs to potential funders. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Grant Writer will assemble and submit grant requests, establish and maintain personal contact and relationships with foundation contacts, conduct prospect research, and maintain a calendar of submissions and other deadlines. To get a response please send RESUME.
10011.title: Grant Writer

10011.description: Education Program Coordinator - Chelsea Sculpture Park. New York , New York. Basic Requirements: BA or MA in related discipline required (Art Education) Post college professional work experience required Demonstrated experience with art education or other informal art programming and curriculum design Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft computer programs and excellent presentation skills Job Responsibilities: Coordinate and develop of new partner-institution/organization relationships and curriculum Provide leadership and direction towards the design and implementation of art educational programming and curriculum in compliance with national and state learning objectives, accreditation guidelines, and innovative art methodologies Establish and grow professional relationships with constituents, peers, associations and partner schools To Apply: Please submit your resume with cover letter and references to the contact information listed below. Set against the backdrop of the Hudson River, Chelsea Sculpture Park will offer fine art for the public to experience, up close and outdoors. The park's mission is to provide an aesthetic oasis in the Chelsea Cove section of Hudson River Park located between 22nd and 26th Streets, just steps away from the world-class Chelsea Art District. We are looking for a Education Program Coordinator to assist the founder and executive-director of Chelsea Sculpture Park develop and implement an educational program foccusing on the exhibitions of the sculpture park.
10011.title: Educational Program - Coordinator

10011.description: Chelsea Sculpture Park New York, New York Are you considering a future in arts administration, nonprofit management, fundraising, arts education or a related field? This is a great opportunity to gain experience working at a brand new nonprofit arts organization that is dedicated to building a sculpture park on the banks of the Hudson River Park. Gain invaluable insights and learn fundraising strategies as part of a dynamic Development team. Assist with prospect research, special events, direct mail, and our donor database, as well as pursue special projects. Internship credit may be arranged through your academic program. The ideal candidate will be organized and detail-oriented, and have good computer skills. Those with prospect research experience and graduate students in arts administration and arts education are especially welcome. The hours for this position are flexible within the work week. A modest stipend is available. To Apply: Please be sure to include current contact information so that we may arrange an interview. To get a response please send RESUME .
10011.title: Development Intern

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of an event chair to lead our organizational committee! Position Summary: Serve as the Lead Event Organizer, overseeing the event from beginning to end. Organize/recruit, motivate and lead a committee of other volunteers as they recruit teams, obtain sponsorship, and plan the event details. Roles and Responsibilities Work with Operations Chair and Staff Partner to follow all Children’s Tumor Foundation policies and procedures as well as state laws and local ordinances as well as the program standards. Know and be able to articulate the CTF mission, vision and messaging points. Recruit volunteer committee leads to manage the various aspects of the event (such as: Media & Publicity, Logistics, Operations, Recruitment, Event Volunteers). Work with Staff Partner to schedule committee meeting dates, develop agendas and facilitate committee meetings. Monitor progress of committee chairs through regular communication to ensure tasks are completed. Enforce accountability with committee members for assigned tasks and the overall event goals. Adhere to pre-approved budget through work with Staff Partner. Assist with identification of the appropriate person to succeed you as Chair. Arrange for appropriate recognition of sub-committee members and event day volunteers. Preferred Skills and Experience: Previous fundraising event organization is preferred but not essential. Organizational skills including general organizing, planning, time management, scheduling, coordinating resources and meeting deadlines. Comfort speaking in front of a group or potential sponsor Excellent communication skills Ability or experience overseeing the work of others. Spreadsheet and/or Google Drive knowledge and experience is a plus. Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Experienced Event Organizer Wanted -NYC

11233.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work on their projects. This field trip needs your help in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. To sign up, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code. We'll provide the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed: Program EA6AB-M Date: Tuesday, May 22nd Time: 12:00 - 2:30 PM Volunteer Role: Field Trip Chaperone About the program: Ann E. Burg’s Unbound, a novel-in-verse that tells the story of a slave family who sought sanctuary in the wilds of the Great Dismal Swamp, inspired sixth-graders to craft their own historical fiction that imagines what that life would have been like. Chaperones will accompany the class to Weeksville, the 19th-century free black community that remains preserved in Brooklyn, for a guided tour to supplement students' research into that period in history. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
11233.title: Field Trip Chaperone for Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn, NYC public school literacy program (EA6ab)

10016.description: Thanks so much for wanting to make a difference. We are recruiting volunteers to be group facilitators for children ages 5-17 (groups are divided according to age), as well as event and fundraising helpers. Please view below for the volunteer type requirements and descriptions. The family and children group sessions are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and harlem. I invite you to visit our website at www.acaringhand.org to learn more about us and to acquire an application: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf. Feel free to contact me directly at RobinGoodman@acaringhand.org for more information or to send A Caring Hand application. View our video about our group program directly at https://vimeo.com/90184263 or on our website, acaringhand.org VOLUNTEER TYPES AND REQUIREMENTS 1) GROUP FACILITATORS: Group facilators must complete an application, have an interview, and attend a 8-12 hour training. One year commitment is required to co-facilitate the child and teen groups. 11 wee group session is held 3 times per year, summer, fall and winter ( Sept - June). A monthly drop in session is held Sept-June. Attendance at a 11 week session is a minimum requirement. In certain circumstances, a commitment for the monthly groups can be accommodated. Group facilitators are assigned to weekly groups during the weekdays and evenings. The days when groups are held vary from season to season. Currently groups are held on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and our monthly groups are held on Thursdays. Indicate your best evening availability during the week. Groups are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and Harlem. 2) VOLUNTEER EVENT HELP: We rely on the generous donations from individuals, corporations, and grants to fund our work. We need a strong volunteer event committe to help with all aspects of our annual gala and other fundraising activities. 3) VOLUNTEER HELPER AND FUNDRAISING: We always need extra hand on deck for various short term projects throughout the year. The projects range from stuffing envelopes and answering phones to doing outreach in th community. Certainly if you have a particular skill aor specific time you would like to help out you should let us know. We also rely on volunteers to help with A Caring Hand, The Billy Esposito Foundation fundraising activities and other board projects. WE WELCOME VOLUNTEERS WITH A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE! APPLY TODAY! Follow this direct link: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf or visit our website at www.acaringhand.org for an application.
10016.title: Volunteer Group Facilitators and Event Help Needed!

10014.description: Hope & Heroes (www.hopeandheroes.org) supports the patients, families, and doctors in the Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology & Stem Cell Transplantation at Columbia University Medical Center. On Sunday, May 20th, we will be having our 9th Annual Walk at Pier 84 (44th St at Hudson River/West Side Highway). We are looking for volunteers to do everything from registration, food/beverage, greeting, cheering, and much more. We will need people from 7AM until 2PM. We would love to have you whether you can stay the full time or just come for a shift. We welcome individuals, families, co-workers, youth groups, school groups, etc. To learn more about the walk please go to www.hopeandheroeswalk.org. Thanks and we look forward to having you join us!

On walk day, join us for a rally program and remembrance ceremony. Volunteers at the walk will help with registration, along the walk route, t-shirt giveaways, water stations, and cheer teams.

A Free Bird has been supported by brands like Google, Amazon, Rite Aid, Chipotle, Macy’s, Barnes and Noble amongst many others, and was recognized by the Department of Education and Department of Cultural Affairs, and honored by Mayor Bill De Blasio at the NYC Mayoral Recognition Award for 2 consecutive years in a row for NYC Volunteer Service. Check out our website and volume 4 of our 2017 magazine to learn more about what A Free Bird does. Job Purpose Analyze financial information and prepare financial reports to determine and maintain record of profit and loss, tax liability, and other financial activities within an organization Responsibilities Prepare, examine, and analyze accounting records, financial statements and financial reports to assess procedural standards, completeness and accuracy Develop, modify, and document recordkeeping and accounting systems. Analyze business operations, trends, costs, financial commitments Maintain and analyze budgets Assist with preparing financial reports and budgets Design and prepare forms and manuals for accounting and bookkeeping personnelle and direct their work activities. Advise management about issues such as budget forecast Report to management regarding the financial statements Qualification Certified Public Accountant (CPA) At least 2 years of experience working for nonprofits Knowledgeable of administrative and clerical procedure and systems such as managing files and records, designing forms Knowledge of regulations: federal, state, and city Experience with auditing Ability to identify complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions Ability to multitask and manage one's own time and the time of others Team player

11201.description: The Cobble Hill Health Center is a 320 bed facility, with a Short-Term Rehabilitation Unit, Alzheimer's Unit, Theraputic Recreation. Volunteers have the opportunity to work directly with the residents if they like, on a regular nursing unit or with the alzheimer residents who are in the Alzheimer's Program. Or if you're a happy go lucky person, you would fit in perfectly in our Theraputic Recreation Program. In Theraputic Recreation volunteers assist in daily activities with the residents which could be anything from baking bread to participating in a play for the residents entertainment. Here at Cobble we are all team players, We call ourselves the Cobble Hill family, because we all work together to keep our residents comfortable.

Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year, we are seeking a highly skilled Human Resources Assistant who can commit 5-10 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. The Volunteer/Intern will maintain records and information for the HR Director. The assistant will schedule appointments, have the ability to work independently and within a team environment; ability to efficiently organize materials and information, ability to easily adjust to changing conditions, maintain effective working relationships with employees, and any other individuals. Responsibilities: Creating charts, spreadsheets, documents within google drive and Microsoft office. Assisting with Calendar appointments. Organizing materials for the information that is within emails, google drive, etc. Scanning/Faxing information through phone or iPad. Effective email communication between volunteers/interns and outside representatives. Competencies: Ability to Research information on the internet. Working towards a degree in Human Resources. Understanding Google Drive Understanding Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc. Highly organized.

11201.description: The objective of the \"Kids Supporting Kids\" program is for these students to be able to express their own artistic and creative side in a group setting as a way to engage in an authentic dialog around their life-altering experience due to cancer. The program focuses on building self-esteem, barrier breaking and education of children affected by cancer, their siblings, classmates and schoolmates. The overarching goal of this program is to increase awareness and sensitize students about the effects of this life-threatening disease on children. We believe that introducing an open conversation about the implications of cancer and its struggle will prove to be a stepping-stone towards achieving a more harmonious and understanding atmosphere for all the students. +Reach out to schools whether through emails, phone calls, social media, in person, etc. +Be comfortable around children, families, and adults to have a conversation with them and get them excited about the program! +Have 5-10 hours per week available to research, email, make phone calls, and create incredible event ideas for the schools. +Creating documents and implementing other volunteers to partake in the events. + Understanding of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Drive. +Be organized, professional, on time, and have the understand this is a volunteer opportunity and taking every opportunity you may have as your last. + Be comfortable with reaching out to vendors, schools, teachers, etc. to make the events happen. +Be able to work independently and in a group setting but also be able to be self motivated to do the work. +Support AFB Mission
11201.title: Kids Supporting Kids Volunteer Coordinator

11201.description: A Free Bird is launching a new program \"AFB Support Group\" which is designed to provide emotional support for the families of the children through the arts. Just like we empower the children of A Free Bird to fight their disease through the arts, we want to empower the family to feel the love and support of one another through all types of art mediums. Since 2008, we have seen how receiving a cancer diagnosis can put a great amount of pain and stress on a family's emotional well being. Though the children are working with art tutors, the parents and children are missing their own form of art therapy. +Giving them the skills to empower them and to use in their everyday life so when they speak to their children they are good and well and can use the skills they used to speak and do not have to unload on others- these parents dont have time of their own so to properly sit down w their kids using movement skills Acquire skills that lead to a healthier lifestyle for individuals and when speaking to children +Finding health and wellness teachers +Must have 3 month availability +Must be able to work on their own and be able to attend the events created +Assist and work with setting up for the event if need be. +Be comfortable with phone calls, emails, and speaking to people in person +Be comfortable speaking with speaking to the parents of the children

11201.description: Join the 2018 Brooklyn Walk to End Alzheimer's Volunteer Planning Committee! We are seeking committee members to help with team recruitment, team retention, sponsorship, logistics, and marketing and outreach leading up to our September 23rd Brooklyn Walk at Cadman Plaza Park. Committee members will: Be trained on the basics of Alzheimer's disease, learn about Alzheimer's Association programs and services, and be trained on our Walk to End Alzheimer's event model. Participate in monthly committee meetings, to be held in Brooklyn or Manhattan. Start or join their own Walk to End Alzheimer's team, help raise awareness and funds, and join us on Walk day to help create an exceptional day-of-event experience for our Brooklyn Walk participants. We have volunteer opportunities to suit all skill sets and interests. The only requirement is a passion to join the fight against Alzheimer's disease! If you're interested in learning more about our Walk Planning Committee, please contact Alex at alschoeneck@alz.org or 646-793-3524.

11201.description: Job Description: Overseeing entire operations of the Fundraising Department.
