10460.title: P.S. 6X Fun and Enrichment Hour!

10460.description: There is a tremendous need, especially for high-risk youth in low-income neighborhoods in The Bronx municipality, for programs that provide activities and support for children during the after school hours and throughout the summer and ACN has stepped up to take the responsibility in addressing this problem through our new initiative (ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING) Project. In 1998, the Children’s Defense Fund reported that violent crime by young people ages 10-17 peaks between 3 and 7 PM; children and teens in poor neighborhoods are struggling for direction and positive opportunities are needed to keep them safe and on-track; a great majority of all American fourth graders cannot read or do math at grade level, including more than five of six black children. In addition, a study published in Pediatrics magazine found that eighth graders who were left alone after school reported greater use of cigarettes, marijuana, and alcohol than those in adult-supervised settings. Current research indicates that supervised after-school and summer programs not only keep children safe and out of trouble, they also significantly improve their academic achievement. PROJECT DESCRIPTION Teaching high-risk, inner-city Youth the skills to become successful in life is at the core of the ACN SUMMER YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING program. The Four(4) major components of the program are: *Homework Assistance through tutoring, mentoring and Use of Computer labs. *Nutrition Education to promote healthy lifestyles and Combat Obesity. *Life Skills which are integrated throughout all phases of the program. *Soccer Instructions where participants engage in fun physical fitness, enjoy the camaraderie of playing in a soccer team format with friends and peers, and learn to become responsible adolescents and adults. The summer After-School Program- will serve approximately 600 children which includes academic tutoring five(5) hours per week and Soccer Instruction, Health and life skills education ten(10) hours per week. Participants will receive Soccer Instruction in professional settings and practice skills in team format play. They will learn about the rules of the game, etiquette, sportsmanship, positive attitudes, fair play, self-esteem, taking responsibility for choices and management of emotions. These life skills are integrated throughout the Soccer program, and instructors routinely demonstrate how they apply to situations in all aspects of life. Nutrition and Healthy lifestyles are stressed both in the Classroom setting and on the Soccer Field. Healthy Snacks will be provided. The ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING program is Fortunate to have a corpse of Volunteers willing to dedicate to the program and are available to work with the children on improving their academic skills. Seeking Volunteers from some of the community based Universities/colleges who will take an active role in the homework area, working individually with the students using current homework assignments. In the computer lab, Volunteer tutors will help the students improve their keyboarding skills and show them how to use the computer for research. They will read aloud with the students and give quizzes on tapes and videos to improve comprehension. When the college/university students volunteers are not on campus, volunteers from local Churches will assume the role of tutors. Incentives will be awarded to the participants based on attendance, good behavior and general attitude.
10460.title: ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT

10460.description: Our students at PS 6X The West Farms School in the Bronx are in need of volunteers to help them unwind after a long day of school work. Typically a group of 3-4 students. Activities include free play and arts & crafts.
10460.title: P.S. 6X Fun and Enrichment Hour!

10460.description: We are currently recruiting adult volunteers (21+) for Spring 2018! Applicants will be invited to an information session and group interview in January or February. We have many different ways you can participate in our volunteer program. Our volunteer specialties offer something for everyone: AMBASSADOR Our Ambassadors have the important role of greeting zoo visitors, helping them to find their way, and sharing \"what’s happening today!\" (2 day training, 8+ hour a month commitment) WCS NOW Our WCS Now Interpreters facilitate interactive, conservation based activities around the zoo. For this role, we are looking for volunteers that are committed to sharing the WCS mission and message, are outgoing and approachable, are comfortable interacting with large groups, and are eager to learn and try new things. (6 day training, plus online courses, 12+ hour a month commitment) EXPEDITION LEADER Expedition Leaders at the Bronx Zoo lead inquiry-based tours for school children, private groups, families, or other pre-registered participants. If you have a passion for engaging people in observation and critical thinking, are an excellent listener with a strong interest in inquiry, are comfortable managing groups of all sizes, and have a commitment to teaching in response to learner feedback-the Expedition Leader role would be a great fit for you! (*Now Interpreter training a prerequisite, 2 day training, 12+ hour a month commitment) PLAY PARTNER As a Play Partner, you will facilitate nature play based activities in our new Nature Trek exhibit, as well as alongside our Conservation Educators and Fellows during Nature Club events and meetings. If you enjoy spending time outside and embracing all the elements, consider becoming a Play Partner volunteer! (1 day training, 12+ hour a month commitment) EDUCATION ASSISTANT As an Education Assistant, you may greet groups as they arrive to the zoo and guide them to their classrooms, provide support to our Conservation Educators during programs or activities, or assist with family programs, birthday parties, or summer camps! (2 day training, 12 + hours a month commitment). ON-CALL EVENT SUPPORT If you’re interested in volunteering at the Bronx Zoo, but have limited time to commit, consider joining us as an On-Call Event Support Volunteer! You’ll be called upon to help with special events throughout the year. (Online training, 1-2 events per year) To learn more, and apply, visit bronxzoo.com/volunteering
10460.title: Volunteer at the Bronx Zoo!

07003.description: The success of Autism Speaks Walk depends on the dedication and support of its volunteers. Volunteers assist in many capacities - set up, checking in participants, providing encouragement at water stops, kids activities and cleaning up after the event. You can recruit friends, family and coworkers to join you! http://act.autismspeaks.org/site/TR/Walk/NewJersey?fr_id=3759&pg=entry
07003.title: 2018 Autism Speaks Northern New Jersey Walk

07003.description: The National MG Walk Campaign is actively searching for a volunteer photographer for the New Jersey MG Walk on Sunday, June 10. The volunteer photographer would be responsible for capturing action shots throughout the Opening Ceremonies and Walk Route, along with taking team pictures prior to the Walk start. We do ask that the volunteer photographer use their own camera, but the MG Walk Team can provide a memory card to use if needed. Please note, you do not have to be a professional photographer to fill this role! We are looking for someone with a passion for photography and making the world a better place! To register as a volunteer for the MG Walk, please visit www.MGWalk.org/Volunteer or contact the MG Walk Team at Volunteers@MGWalk.org or 1-855-MG-WALKS.
07003.title: New Jersey MG Walk - Volunteer Photographer Needed!

07003.description: The National MG Walk Campaign is actively searching for a volunteer DJ for the New Jersey MG Walk on Sunday, June 10. The volunteer DJ would be responsible for playing family-friendly music, MG Walk start music at the end of the opening ceremony, and the National Anthem if there is no singer present. DJ should have all their own equipment. To register as a volunteer for the MG Walk, please visit www.MGWalk.org/Volunteer or contact the MG Walk Team at Volunteers@MGWalk.org or 1-855-MG-WALKS (649-2557).
07003.title: New Jersey MG Walk - Volunteer DJ Needed

07003.description: The National MG Walk Campaign is actively searching for a volunteer Face Painter for the New Jersey MG Walk on Sunday, June 10. We can provide a table and chairs, but the volunteer Face Painter should have their own materials. To register as a volunteer for the MG Walk, please visit www.MGWalk.org/Volunteer or contact the MG Walk Team at Volunteers@MGWalk.org or 1-855-MG-WALKS (649-2557).
07003.title: New Jersey MG Walk - Volunteer Face Painter Needed!

07003.description: The National MG Walk Campaign is actively searching for volunteers to assist with the New Jersey MG Walk on Sunday, June 10. Volunteers at the MG Walk may assist with the following volunteer roles: - Walker Check-In - Distribute food & beverages - Walk Route Marshals - Rest Stop Please note, volunteer roles vary based on the number of volunteers recruited for the MG Walk. We do our best to match volunteers with their preferred roles, but appreciate your flexibility on event day! To register as a volunteer for the MG Walk, please visit www.MGWalk.org/Volunteer or contact the MG Walk Team at Volunteers@MGWalk.org or 1-855-MG-WALKS (649-2557). All volunteers under the age of 18 must have a parent or guardian sign their event waiver prior to the event, or upon arrival. All volunteers under the age of 14 must also be accompanied by an adult during the event.
07003.title: New Jersey MG Walk - Volunteers Needed!

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07073.description: Walk With Us To Cure Lupus - New Jersey! Walkers and Volunteers Needed! Walkers needed to help raise funds for lupus research. Form a team or walk individually. Be a part of the cause and join us today! Volunteers are needed to assist with set-up, clean-up, handing out food and water, cheering our walkers on and working tables. We are also looking for people to donate their services if they are massage therapists, photographers, bag pipers and marching bands to lead the walk. Entertainment for children is also in need. Please contact Joanne Golombos for more information: jgolombos@lupusresearch.org or call 732-842-1607
07073.title: Walk With Us to Cure Lupus - New Jersey

10469.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opporunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10469.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

11793.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with general registration at Walk MS: Jones Beach! Walk MS: Jones Beach 2018 will be held on Saturday, May 19th at Jones Beach - Field 1 on Long Island. We need over 200 volunteers for this exciting event - we welcome groups and individuals of all ages & abilities to join us as volunteers! Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR/Walk/NYHWalkEvents?pg=entry&fr_id=29834 General Registration Team Date: Saturday, May 19 Location: Jones Beach, Field 1 (1 Ocean Parkway, Wantagh, NY 11793) Time: General Registration - 7:00am-11:00am Description: Greet and sign-in walkers as well as help registration run efficiently- Volunteers must be 18+ & Background Check If you have any questions, please contact: Amber Young - Manager, Volunteer Engagement at Amber.Young@nmss.org
11793.title: General Registration Volunteers Needed at Walk MS: Jones Beach!

07470.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. The Editor is responsible for reviewing articles submitted by The Borgen Project’s national team of writers. Editors will also perform edits for articles appearing on BORGEN Magazine and The Borgen Project Blog. Our volunteer position is a part-time, work from home role. You can set your own schedule and specify how many hours per week you wish to work. - Edit and format articles submitted by national writers. - Work with writers to improve their articles. Qualifications: Must have great editing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required. To apply: Please email a copy of your resume and two writing samples to hr@borgenproject.org
07470.title: Volunteer Editor- New Jersey

07023.description: The Service-Learning Instructor assists in facilitating The Need2Read Program Inc.'s community service program for 7th grade students from various districts including Scotch Plains-Fanwood, Plainfield, Westfield, and Cranford. The instructor uses pre-approved lesson plans and activities to help students become informed about the links between poverty and illiteracy while also teaching students the importance of planning in life with a segway into the importance of proper lesson planning for a literacy program. Students are challenged to break into teams, select from a group of random items and create their own lesson plans for a specific age group. The following week, each team visits a local shelter partnered with our organization and they host a 1-hour literacy program with the children in the shelter program. The program finishes off with a lesson in identifying literacy challenges in our own communities among our peers and is followed up with a subsequent literacy day for the community. The literacy day is planned by the students and all games are created or reinvented by the students. They invite their collective communities, family, and friends out to the event where students are awarded and recognized for their work. Lesson plans, activities, and supplies are provided to the instructor. The group will meet on Thursdays April-May. One Wednesday evening (6:30pm-7:30pm) is also required for the visit with homeless youth. The Literacy day event will be held on Saturday, May 19th from approximately 12pm-3pm. For more information about our organization please visit: www.TheNeed2Read.org and our Facebook page at: www.Facebook.com/TheNeed2Read
07023.title: Seeking Short-term Instructor for 7th Grade Service-Learning Program
